loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is farming and livestock trade. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a cow and goats for sale. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: purchase a cow and goats for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gina dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 62 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, milk, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, su familia siempre fue de escasos recursos económicos y por esa razón no pudo seguir estudiando, actualmente está soltera, tiene 3 hijas de las cuales 2 viven con ella y son las únicas que dependen económicamente de ella.

Concepción, se dedica a vender diferentes productos de primera y segunda necesidad, en su tienda que actualmente posee, ella tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio, comenta que hace tiempo su mamá realizaba ventas similares y fue eso lo que la motivo a colocar su propio negocio, antes de dedicarse a este negocio ella vendía cosméticos, el negocio está a 10 kilometros y aborda un autobús para llegar a él y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:00 de la tarde.

Concepción, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como azúcar, aceite, arroz, frijol, queso, frutas y verduras, ella considera que con la inversión que realice tendrá más diversificación de productos en su tienda.

Concepción, sueña con tener un negocio más grande y además desea mejorar su vivienda y vivir en mejores condiciones con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción is 52 years old and studied up until sixth grade. Her family has always had limited economic resources, and because of this, she was not able to continue studying. She is currently single and has three daughters, two of whom live with her and are the only ones that still depend on her.

Concepción sells different types of basic items in the store she currently owns. She has been working in this business for three years. She says that her mother used to work in a similar business, and that's what motivated her to start her own business. Before, she sold cosmetics. Her business is 10 kilometers away. She takes a bus to get there, and works from 8:00am until 4:00pm.

Concepción needs this loan in order to purchase more inventory like sugar, oil, rice, beans, cheese, fruits, and vegetables. She believes that this investment will allow her to diversify the products she offers in her store. Concepción's dream is to have a bigger business, as well as improve her house and live in better conditions with her whole family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, rice, beans, cheese, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works selling and delivering peanut butter in her community. Her products are popular with her neighbors because they are affordable and good quality. Ma. Luisa is now delivering peanut butter in bulk. She is very thankful to Kiva for her previous 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy five sacks of rice, two boxes of canned goods, and peanut butter, soft drinks, noodles and other items she sold in her store. Ma. Luisa was able to repay her loan on time and increase her income. She used the profit from her loan to help pay school expenses for her children. 

Ma. Luisa is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries and peanut butter to resell and deliver to her customers. With holidays fast approaching, she needs to restock her store and stock peanut butter. Ma. Luisa will be able to increase her income and still sell her items in much affordable price. In the future, she wants to maintain her store and add future items to increase her income, help provide for her family, and most of all, provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy groceries and peanut butter to sell and deliver to customers

loans.name: Dushigikirane-Mbugangali Group

texts.en:
Chantal is 32 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 6. Chantal is the president of the Dushigikirane-Mbugangali group, and is holding a paper in her hand in the photo.

She runs a clothing business and has been in this business for two years. She typically sells second-hand clothes.

Chantal requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to purchase more second-hand clothing to sell, and she says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family status, and she will be able to expand her business by buying more and different clothes.

In the future, she hopes to save enough money to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children. He grows and sells tea leaves and has been in this business for the last seven years.

Ben has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya, and he plans to purchase fertilizer and tea seedlings for planting to be able to harvest more tea leaves to sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his business to pay school fees for his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming, make more income and be able to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and tea seedlings for planting to be able to harvest more tea leaves to sell and make more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Fredegundo

texts.es:
Fredegundo con 33 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos, vive en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú, en una zona rural.Cuenta con buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Fredegundo se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cafeto, de la variedad catimor sembrando 2 has de cafeto de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserío Buenos Aires del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, se dedica a la agricultura hace 10 años y hace 4 años cultiva cafeto,adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Es socio nuevo en nuestra institución, Edpyme Alternativa. Cliente firmara con cónyuge.
texts.en:
33-year-old Fredegundo has a stable home with his wife and 2 children. He lives in his own home, which is made of rustic materials, in a rural area in the district of Santo Tomás. Santo Tomás is in Cutervo province, in Peru's Cajamarca department. The local people have good things to say about his personality and his work.
Fredegundo works in agriculture, cultivating the Catimor variety of coffee on his own 2 hectare plantation, which is in the village of Buenos Aires in Santo Tomas de Cutervo district. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years and has been growing coffee for 4. He also rears and sells small animals and grows ingredients for making bread and has plenty of experience. He will use the loan to maintain his crops so he can have abetter yield and a higher income. As a result, he will be able to improve his own and his family's quality of life.
He is a new member of our institution, Edpyme Alternativa. The client will sign with his wife.

loans.use: to maintain his crops

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas is 64 years old and married. She works buying and selling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice farming. Lagrimas works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.

Lagrimas is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 49 years old and single. For the past ten years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Luisa is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 45 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Sandra works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Sandra has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Sandra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, a 41-year-old businesswoman selling local footwear inside a Baseco, Philippines, market. She’s able to support the educational expenses of her child and pay for other bills with earnings from the business. Good health is what she prays for so that she’ll be able to run the business for her family.

She’s earning about PHP 12,000 every month and is thankful to God for being blessed with having her own business to manage.

Like other entrepreneurs, Josephine aspires to have added designs of footwear to sell so that customers will have a variety of choices. Right now, she is starting to save money for future purposes.

She believes that a loan of PHP 15,000 that she recently applied for will make a vast impact on her business, since the amount will be used to add different kinds of footwear that will result in a sales increase. She also dreams of having her own place so that she’ll not pay for a monthly rental anymore.

Josephine is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. This is where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of footwear for her business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She operates a bakery in the Philippines.

Melanie requested another loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her bakery. She hopes to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham, 47 years old, is a married woman with five children who lives in the city of Hebron. She started sewing by working for several sewers, then she began her own sewing project three years ago.

Siham has decided to take a loan from ACAD to buy sewing material and increase her sales. The main source of income for the family is her husband's income; he works in construction. The extra income from this project will be an additional source of income in order to improve the living status of the family.

Siham hopes to expand this project and open a sewing shop. Siham's challenge is a lack of people who deal with her, in addition to the difficulty of marketing.

She would like to thank ACAD and Kiva for giving her this chance to share her story.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as silk and textiles.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for nine years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like margarine, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Dukore-Byahi Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 32 years old and married with 3 children, ages 2-9. She runs a boutique store. Vestine is the president of the group DUKORE-BYAHI, she has a paper in her hands. Vestine has been in this business for 5 years and sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, lotions... in her store. 

She requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to purchase more sugar,salt,cooking oil, rice etc and she says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family status and she will be able to pay school fees regularly for her children. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, rice, soap, beans etc for her business

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Benita; la socia sigue dedicándose al  negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia sigue vendiendo caramelos, chicles, chupetes entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a  este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chocolates, dulces entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The lady, whose name is Benita, is a member of the “IMASUMAC I” communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name. She is a responsible and determined person. She still sells sweets, chewing gum, lollies, etc. to her customers who ask for them. She has been running her business for some time and, amongst other things, this gives her personal pleasure because it enables her to support her family. She is applying for the loan to buy goods such as chocolates and sweets. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back in full.

loans.use: to buy goods such as chocolates and sweets.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a mother of five children from Pasay, City Philippines. She is 42 years old and manages a wellness business and is also involved in a direct selling of personal care products. She has been in the business for 10 years and a loyal member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT). Currently, Sally is renting a small space to run her wellness business. She aspires to have her own space so that she’ll no longer pay for monthly rental. She also wants to expand the business by adding services like a spa in addition to her massage service. The business really helped her sustain her children’s educational expenses, which is why she is determined to make the business grow. To make this happen, Sally applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP. This amount will be used to buy necessities for her wellness business. 

Sally has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This made her become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy necessities for her wellness center business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou wants to send her deepest gratitude to lenders who extended their help through the previous loan granted to her. Without that loan it might have taken a long time before she could refill the bulk quantity of grocery products for her variety store business. The loan became a way for her to attract patrons and increase her sales.

The daily income earned from her variety store is what she uses to pay her bills and other household expenses. She is determined to make her business grow for her family and her children’s education. Marilou also is compassionate about helping others. She dreams that God will use her as an extension of His blessing to those in need. Marilou applied for a loan worth of Php 15,000 this time to add grocery items for her variety store business. She’s aiming to be successful not just for her family and friends, but also to help other people. 

Marilou is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Aida is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional items like canned goods, spices, sugar, diapers and other groceries.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, spices, sugar, diapers and other groceries.

loans.name: Libertina

texts.en:
Libertina previously accessed a loan of IDR 10,000,000 to purchase green technologies to sell in her community. She successfully repaid this fifth loan off in just  two months. She has sold almost 400 technologies in her hometown Kupang and on her island of birth, Sabu. 

To help continue operating her business, she is requesting another loan of IDR 20.000.000. She will use the loan to buy a stock of clean energy technologies and provide solutions to her customers problems such as difficult access to clean water, and lack of electricity.  

Libertina is a woman, mother and entrepreneur. She lives in Kupang with her husband and children and they have recently moved into their new house which was built using the business profits. She is now saving for her children’s education.

loans.use: to introduce simple, clean energy products to her community.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is involved in providing home renovation service to local people in Ararat, Armenia. He lives there with his wife, who is a teacher at school, and son. 
Artur has been doing his work as a builder for ten years. Over those hard years, he became more professional and skilled and gathered more and more clients. Artur asked for this loan to purchase tools (rotary hammer drill and tile cutter). He  has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools for his construction business.

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.en:
His name is Perfecto, aged 57, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Cornelia, his business partner, and they have three children of whom two are in college while the eldest is already working. The couple works hard to send their children to college since they believe that a good education is their hope and path to better opportunities in life.

Perfecto took advantage of the cool climate in the upland area by going into the ornamental plant business. He has been growing ornamental plants for seven years already. He grows garden plants such as golden shower, ylang ylang, bromeliads and a variety of hanging plants. It has been his source of income to provide for his family's basic needs.

To help him sustain his farm, he is requesting a loan in the amount of a PHP 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer, pots, nets, and various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamentals. Perfecto gives his best efforts to grow his farm since since it is his only means to send his children to school. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help.

Perfecto hopes to buy a vehicle to transport plants to customers. He prays for good health and an abundant life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pots, nets, and various seedlings.

loans.name: Imar Janneker

texts.en:
Imar Janneker, is making income through his internet cafe and convenience store business. He is 25 years old and single. He never gets tired of tending his internet cafe and store. Imar Janneker's passion is selling, and he earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support his needs.

Imar Janneker is a full fledged member of PMPC and applied for a loan to buy additional computer unit for his internet cafe. Imar Jannekel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he is determined to pursue his goals.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer unit for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio has been a farmer for almost 40 years. He grew up with a farmer father and had mastered the art of farming from land preparations up, to post harvest operations and earning an income from it. This has been his source of living that had sent all his children to school until they got a good job.

Recently, he needed an amount to pay for labor cost in land preparation such as plowing, harrowing, leveling and purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of pesticides that he took a loan from Paglaum MPC where he is an active member.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in land preparation such as plowing, harrowing, leveling and purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of pesticides

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 50 years old and married with four children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase of fishing net.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Jenebeth

texts.en:
Jenebeth works hard to support her family. Jenebeth is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.

Jenebeth has been in this business for 7 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is 51 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her son has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 5 years.

Zakia's son needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints, her son is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purpose. Therefore Zakia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her son to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her son can earn more profitable income.

On this financial assistance Zakia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's tailoring business.

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
GAUDENCIA is in her early 60s and is married with two children, one of which is still in school.  She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and genge business for seven years now.  She works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be GAUDENCIA's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the charcoal stock and started the genge business and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, to buy a plot of land and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan buy sacks of charcoal and to restock the out of stock items in the genge store. She dreams of building and finish his house,

GAUDENCIA  will share this loan with her loan group Iringa which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to restock the out of stock items in the genge store.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia lives a simple life with her family in a town of Trinidad, in Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband earn a living through their rice farming business. They have been doing this for 23 years. Aside from rice farming, they are also engaged in farming palm oil trees.

Lucresia and her husband work together to raise their six children, two adults and four school aged children ages 20, 17, 15 and seven years old. In the future, she wishes to improve their livelihood to have enough money to send all her school aged children in college. She wished for them to finish their studies to have better life in the future. Thus, Lucresia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is 58 years old, a widow and runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) i Tugas, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She ventured into business since her husband passed away, to support the needs of her family. She's supported by financially by Paglaum MPC wherein she is a member in good standing. Recently, she avails her 11th loan to restock store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar and others.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar and others

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 53 years old. She is married to David who is a business man, and they are blessed with two children of 22 and 32 years.

Jecinta has had a clothing business for five years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 35,000. She has borrowed KES 55,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her third loan after repaying the previous loans successfully.

Jecinta will use the loan to purchase different outfits of various designs including dresses and shirts to resell. Therefore, she hopes that the anticipated profits will help her to buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children, cater to their medical care, as well as expand the business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well-established business and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase different outfits of various designs including dresses and shirts to resell.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina has been granted a number of loans in the past which helped to sustain her eatery. She is thankful for Kiva and its supporters for their tireless support on her livelihood.

Once more she is seeking your support in the amount of Php 15000 to buy more products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, utensils and frozen food products to cook dishes to sell at her food stall.

She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business.

Ludivina's precious dream is to see her only child, who is already working, to be successful in his chosen field.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies .

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdalene is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Her business is mobile money transfer (M-PESA) retail shop and farming. She has been in the business for three years. She earns a monthly income of seventeen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use it to boost her business and the profits to expanded her farming business.

Magdalene hopes and dreams are to grow her business and to open other shops.

loans.use: to boost her money transfer business.

loans.name: Renevel

texts.en:
This 43 year old entrepreneur is Renevel from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She has been profiting from selling of DXN products, mainly ginseng coffee and other food supplements. Her husband, Juanito, is working as a farmer and their combined income sustains their family with two children. As of now their children are still in elementary level and they want to save enough money for their college education. 

Renevel applied for PHP 8,000 loan to enhance her direct selling business. She has already expanded her network of customers who regularly place orders from her. She will use this additional capital to buy those pre-ordered food supplements plus more reserved items to sell. With this, she can boost her income and savings for the future. She’s really positive that KIVA lenders are very much willing to extend help to small entrepreneurs like her who is trying her best to improve her business.

She is a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative who regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more food supplements to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 44 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Luz has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nice

texts.en:
Nice is a new client of UGAFODE microfinance ltd and is 32 years. She is a very active person involved in agriculture especially coffee and cattle rearing. She is married with 4 children, all school going, with one in secondary school and 3 in basic level and also with a stepchild whom she is taking care of.

She has requested for a loan of ugx1,500,000 to improve her agricultural production, especially coffee and milk from her cows. She also owns a retail shop where she earns an additional income and she started his business in 2012. She carries on her agriculture in the rural area of kakanju village,Kakanju parish, Bushenyi district.

She began the business to earn additional income for the development. When she gets the loan, she will use it to buy fertilizers for her coffee plantation to increase production and after buy more cows to increase the milk production.

Nice hopes to boost her agricultural business and to improve the welfare of her family.
She is faced by bad weather conditions, especially in dry season which reduces on her yields, limited capital to boost his business and also pests and diseases which destroy crops.
She is honest and hard working

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cows to improve her business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Lastec Day Care and Primary School was established in 1998 and is run by Ronald. Lastec School was initially a nursery school offering pre-grade tuition and has since grown to provide enrollment for pre- school and primary school aged children in the community of Emmasdale.

Lastec believes in setting a strong foundation in the education of children and on this basis the school was established with the vision of providing the best early child education in the community through a dedicated team.

Lastec would like to address the challenges they are facing in terms of limited resources, an inadequate number of well trained teachers and ICT lesson disruptions due to frequent power cuts by implementing the use of the ZEduPads, for the benefit of the learning of the children at the school.

The ZEduPad is an educational tablet that is preloaded with e-learning content with teacher lesson plans and lessons for every subject and all primary school grades. The content is mapped to the national primary school curriculum and approved and supported by the Ministry of Education and also has teacher training modules for untrained volunteer teachers.

The educational tablet is being used through-out Zambia and many other countries in Africa.

loans.use: to purchase the ZEduPads for the children in his school.  These are educational tablets pre-loaded with e-learning content, mapped to the national primary school curriculum.

loans.name: Tuungane A Group

texts.fr: Denise est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Tuungane A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 8 enfants dont 7 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés au marché central de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 240 poissons. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité et construire une belle maison. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Denise is a saleswoman and a member of the "Tuungane A" Group, a client of the field partner Hekima. She is is a 45-year-old, married mother of eight children, seven of whom are in school and one who is young.

She has been selling dried fish at the central market for four years. She will purchase a supply of 240 fish. She started her business with funds received from her husband.

She hopes to grow her business and build a pretty house. Lastly, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it provides entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To buy a supply of 240 fish.

loans.name: Sebastiana Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo, es madre de tres hijos, ella no pudo estudiar porque su familia era muy pobre y no le pudieron dar la educación necesaria, por razones personales se separo del padre de sus tres hijos, quedando ella a cargo de su familia; actualmente todos son mayores de edad, dos de ellos trabajan en dulcerías de la zona y le ayudan con gastos del hogar.  

Amparo, tiene dos años de dedicarse a la venta de paletas, ella se dedica al comercio desde muy joven, ya que no logro estudiar, sus padres le mandaban a vender frutas, verduras y también trabajaba en las dulcería del cantón, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su vivienda, y en ocasiones también se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa de los vecinos Y en su negocio las ventas son durante todo el día. 

Ella utilizara el crédito para comprar más paletas para su venta y para hacer mangoneadas que los clientes le piden con frecuencia, con ello espera mejorar sus ventas y lograr brindar a sus hijos las condiciones de vida que siempre ha soñado. 

Ella sueña con terminar de construir su casa porque donde vive actualmente es de bahareque y las paredes se dañan con mucha frecuencia.
texts.en: Amparo is the mother of three children. She was notable to go to school because her family was very poor and they could not give her the education she needed. She separated from her children's family for personal reasons, which has left her to support her family alone. Her children are now grown up - two of them work in local sweetshops and help her with the household expenses. Amparo has been selling pallets for two years, having started to do so when she was very young, as she could not go to school. Her parents sent her out to sell fruit and vegetables and she also worked in local sweetshops. She runs her business from her home and she sometimes also washes and irons clothes for her neighbours. She sells her pallets all day long. She will use the loan to buy more pallets to sell and to make mangoneadas (mango ice-cream) which her customers often ask her for. She hopes that this will enable her to boost her sales and give her children the quality of life she has always dreamed of. Her ambition is to finish building her house because the place she currently lives in is made of adobe and the walls frequently get damaged.

loans.use: to buy more pallets to sell,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and restock her food store.

loans.name: Mkatajika Group

texts.en:
Harun who is in his mid 50's is married with seven kids, four of whom are in school. Harun has been running two projects, a retail shop and poultry raising for seventeen years now. He works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Harun's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory, started the poultry business and has managed to pay back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing well. He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in his shop like sugar, salt, cooking oil, beans, rice etc.and to buy chicks and chicken feed. He dreams of expanding his business.

Harun will share this loan with his loan group Mkatajika which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in his shop like sugar, salt, cooking oil, beans, rice etc. and to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Francisca continua con su  negocio de elaboración de colchones, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo los colchones a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para elaborar los colchones.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Dulce Nombre De Jesús communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district in the Cusco department. The member, Francisca, continues with her business of making mattresses. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She continues selling mattresses to her customers who request them. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, which brings her satisfaction on a personal and other levels.

She wishes to be able to continue working in this way in order to continue supporting her family. She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her established payments.

She is requesting the loan to buy material to make mattresses.

loans.use: to buy material to make mattresses.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.es:
Anatalia es una mujer de 63 años de edad, casada, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas de arroz.
Ella es emprendedora, activa y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por el reunir a inmigrantes de todos los rincones del país.
Anatalia es de cabello corto, usa lentes de aumento y de baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la elaboración de empanadas de arroz; esta se sirve para compartir en un delicioso desayuno o en una rica merienda, son el complemento perfecto, "es un horneado típico, fácil de preparar, a base de arroz y yuca…" comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar canastas para transportar las masas harina por quintal. Su sueño es tener una panadería grande, ella desea comprar canastas de pana y harina por quintal. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 5 años que lleva con esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Anatalia solicita un préstamo para la compra de canastas de pan y harina por quintal para su panadería.
texts.en:
Anatalia, age 63, is married and has independent children. Her business is selling rice empenadas. She is enterprising, active, and very steadfast. She conducts her business in the 'plan 3000' neighborhood, which is known for bringing together immigrants from all corners of the country.

Anatalia has short hair, wears glasses, and is short. Her mother tongue is Guaraní , and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works. They live in their own house made of wood, and it has all of the basic services.

Her business is making rice empenadas, which are good for a delicious breakfast or a tasty snack. They are the perfect addition to the diet. "It is a typical baked good, easy to prepare, and made from rice and cassava," she says.

The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy baskets to transport the flour dough in hundred pound units.

Her dream is to have a large bakery. She wishes to buy baskets and flour in 100 pound units. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the five years that she has been engaged in this business activity. It is for these reasons that Anatalia requests a loan to buy bread baskets and flour in hundred pound units for her bakery.

loans.use: to buy baskets of bread and flour in hundred pound units for her bakery.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
Demetrio has been a farmer for a long period of time. He works the land and grows rice. He resides in Ormoc, City. He is married with two children ages 13 and 20 years old.

He owns a rice paddy and sells rice to the local dwellers in his place upon harvest. He faces challenges in his livelihood, the lack of capital and the high cost of farm maintenance.

Demetrio would like to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings, and pay expenses for the laborers. This would help him boost and improve the yield of his farm. It will enable him to provide for his family’s needs and continue to expand his farm to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings, and pay expenses for the laborers.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 52 years old, married and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She has been into nipa thatch making for a long time that sufficiently provides the needs of her family. She is financially supported by Paglaum MPC and had availed various loan products including insurance and healthcare services.

Now that she needs additional capital to purchase bamboo sticks, nipa and other items for nipa thatch making for roofing materials that she asks from the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo sticks, nipa and others for nipa thatch making for roofing materials

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 34 year-old entrepreneur, who owns a barber shop business and a billiard table rental. She’s from Malibay and a very active member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s thankful to God for these businesses, which she has been operating for almost 2 years. Through all her hard work she was able to support her children’s educational expenses and pay for their household bills.

Marilou starts to save money for she dreams of starting up other business' in the future. She wants that barbershop to be air-conditioned so that customers will be more comfortable while enjoying their desired services. An amount of approximately Php 8 000 is needed and she is anticipating that lenders will once again consider her loan request. 

Despite being busy managing the business, Marilou spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: The amount will be used to have her barber shop air-conditioned.

loans.name: Jhonbrell

texts.en:
Jhonbrell is 29 years old, married and lives in Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He finds fortune in farming that he rigorously attend to everyday. As a farmer, he nurtures also his membership with Paglaum MPC wherein he is a MIGS member.

In need of additional inventories of fertilizers and pesticides, he asks for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of pesticides

location.town: Tangub - Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en: Melvin is an active member of Paglaum MPC where he accessed all his financial needs relating to his farming activities and personal needs. He lives in Silangit, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Melvin is heading up for the next cropping season that he asks for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers, pesticides and higher yielding seeds.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers, pesticides and higher yielding seeds

loans.name: Zhirayr

texts.en:
Zhirayr is retailer from Armavir town. He lives with his wife and two grown up children. Zhirayr has been involved in a retail business for five years.

He organizes the selling process from his house. The product variety that he sells by season. In autumn Zhirayr sells ice cream, egg, Lavash (armenian national bread), vegetables. In spring he sells products like fruits, vegetables and other home supplies.

Zhirayr asks for this loan to pay for renovations of the second floor of the house where he organizes his business.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his house where he organizes his business.

loans.name: Lalanie

texts.en:
Lalanie is 51 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are enrolled in school

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lalanie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lalanie has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, es madre de tres hijos, estudio hasta noveno grado, porque su familia era escasos recursos economicos y no le pudieron dar la educación que necesitaba, está casada, pero por problemas familiares se separaro de su esposo y tomó sola la responsabilidad de sus hijos, actualmente uno de sus hijos trabaja de jornalero y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. 

Paula, tiene 16 años de dedicarse a la venta de pan dulce y también hace tamales los fines de semana para vender, desde muy joven su madre le enseño a trabajar y ser independiente, ella vende por las tardes y ocasionalmente una de sus hijas le ayuda a vender. 

Paula, solicita el préstamo para comprar levadura, azúcar, huevo, etc. con ello espera mejorar mucho más su margen de ganancia y de esa forma brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.

Ella sueña con construir su casa con mejores condiciones, porque donde vive actualmente es de bahareque y las paredes son inseguras.
texts.en:
Paula, who is the mother of three children, only went to school until year nine, because her family were short of money and were not able to give her the education she needed. She is married but, for family reasons, she separated from her husband and now supports her children alone. One of her sons currently works as a labourer and helps her with the household expenses. Paula has been selling pan dulce for 16 years and she also makes and sells tamales at the weekend. her mother taught her to work and be independent when she was still very young. She sells pan dulce in the evening, with the help of one of her daughters. Paula is applying for the loan to buy yeast, sugar, eggs, etc. and she hopes that this will enable her to greatly increase her profit margin and, as a result, provide the best possible living conditions for her family. Her ambition is to build a better house, because the pace where she lives at the moment is made of adobe and the walls are safe.







Paula, solicita el préstamo para comprar levadura, azúcar, huevo, etc. con ello espera mejorar mucho más su margen de ganancia y de esa forma brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.



Ella sueña con construir su casa con mejores condiciones, porque donde vive actualmente es de bahareque y las paredes son inseguras.

loans.use: to buy yeast, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
SAMINA is a 31 year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring at her home. She has been doing it for the past four years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. She sews garments of ladies in the neighborhood or her hometown. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 
To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has become worn out due to continuous use. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.
SAMINA thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to continue her sewing business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 44-year-old married woman living with her family members, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan.

She has been running a raw material selling shop related to tailoring, which is the only source of income for the family. Many tailors and the ladies of her town like to buy laces, spools, threads, needles and packs of zippers from her. Her customers appreciate her collection for laces.

Currently she is interested in purchasing some of the latest variety of expensive laces to enhance her income, but finds it difficult due to financial constrains. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help her to grow business as well as net income. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material related to tailoring for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
La socia Magali pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS,  la socia continua  con su negocio de venta  de pollos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo sus animales a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos entre otros.
texts.en:
Magali belongs to the Dulce Nombre De Jesús communal bank. She continues with her business of selling chickens. She is a responsible and hard-working woman. She continues selling her animals to the customers who request them. She has been engaged in this business for a good amount of time, which brings her satisfaction on a personal level as well as others.

She wishes to be able to continue working in this way in order to continue supporting her family. She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her established payments. She is requesting the loan to buy chickens, among other items.

loans.use: to buy chickens and other items.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 49 years old. He is married and has two children.  He runs several businesses mobile money transfer, dairy farming and poultry keeping. He has been in business for four years. He earns a monthly income of eighteen thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow. He will use the profits from expanded business to buy chicks and poultry feeds. His hopes and dreams are to have a successful dairy farming business.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 44 years old, a member of CCT's Silang, Cavite branch. She is married to Rodrigo, her jeepney driver with whom she has three children. She has been a jeepney operator for eight years, which is her sole means of income to fund her family's daily sustenance.

In the Philippines, jeepneys, which were originally American military service vehicles during World War II, have been converted into transportation vehicles by making them two meters longer and putting two long upholstered seats in them. Since then it has become the most common and cheapest form of public transportation.

A regular and proper maintenance of her vehicle is necessary to ensure efficient performance and steady income. In view of this, Concepcion is humbly requesting for a Php 19000 loan to pay for spare parts like tires and regular maintenance to avoid breakdown. She hopes for a positive response on her request. This will assure her of a regular earnings to support their daily personal and household needs. 

Concepcion hopes to save up enough money so can start her dream, a mini-store. She also prays for abundance in their lives and for her children to finish their studies. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

 * All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for accessories, spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 31 years old. She is married to Kennedy, who is a businessman, and they are blessed with 2 children of 7 and 3 years old. 

She has had a salon business for 6 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 15,000. 

She has borrowed KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her second loan, after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Felister will be using the loan to purchase salon items like hair oils, relaxers and hot combs. With the anticipated profits, she will buy food for the family as well as pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established business and enjoy a better live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase salon items like hair oils, relaxers and hot combs

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 67 years old, married, and has eight children.  He operates a retail shop, which he has been doing for 40 years. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

James requested his third loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt, maize flour, beans, rice, and detergents and pay school fees for his children. He will use the profits from his expanded business to buy a dairy cow and venture into zero grazing dairy farming. He hopes  to expand his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt, maize flour, beans, rice, and detergents and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 44 years old, married and has three children.

She works to fatten pigs in the Philippines.

Bernadette requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernadette has been fattening pigs for 12 years, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernadette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is a speech therapist by profession. She works in her house with children which have specific disabilities in speech. She has separated a special room in her house as a office and it is a suitable environment for children to take classes there.

Lusine asks this loan to be able to purchase professional literature and tools needed for her work as a speech therapist. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Lusine is a mother of two little children and she likes the job she is doing.

loans.use: to pay for professional literature and tools needed for providing speech therapy to children

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa lives in Maliana, is married and a business women. She has been doing business since 2013 with her own working capital of $200.00. She is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital, to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store, aqua, cooking oils, candies, noodles, slippers, shampoo, salt, eggs,  including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. She wants to open a big store in the future , so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy aqua, cooking oils, candies, noodles, slippers, shampoo, salt, eggs,  including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 47 year old woman. She is in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary,52, is a divorcee and a mother of 5 children; 4 girls and 1 boy. She has been unable to secure a stable job and relies on part-time jobs as well as government grants to support her children. She is relentless and is always looking for opportunities to grow. She is now a member of a self-help group that was formed in her neighborhood to try and alleviate its members from poverty.

She is an active member and has identified an opportunity in the poultry business. She is requesting for a loan to build a chicken coop in her backyard as well as to buy chicks and to buy chicken feed. She wants to raise the chicken and sell them to vendors, houses and restaurants at an affordable price.
"I will be able to have money to pay school fees for my children and take my firstborn to college" says a hopeful Mary.

loans.use: to build a coop, buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maiz, maicillo y frijol desde hace 10 años y comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como: abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
This 28 year old man lives in high-risk area. He cultivates corn, sorghum and beans for 10 years and markets his products in the surrounding towns. His earnings enable him to cover the household expenses. He lives in his own home with his wife and two children.

He requests a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, pest control, etc. in order to continue his work and to have better income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Icyizere Group

texts.en:
Bernadette is 50 years old and married with 2 children, ages 3 and 17. Bernadette is a widow and she is selling beans, sorghum and potatoes to support her family . Bernadette is the president of the ICYIZERE group and is the one who has a paper in her hands including money.

She has been in this business for 25 years and sells beans, sorghum and potatoes. Bernadette has two employees in her business.

She requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to purchase more beans, sorghum and potatoes to sell and she says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family status and she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantities of beans,sorghum and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita of Trinidad has had a rice farming business since 2012. She is 29 years old with three young children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm to maintain her crops. She hope to increase her harvest so she can save for her children while they are still young. Her savings will then be used for their school expenses someday. In the coming days, Lolita plans to venture unto a food vending business to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Resyl

texts.en: Resyl is a from Matag-ob, Leyte. She is engaged in a food vending business, selling pork barbecue or grilled pork and a Sari-sari store. She has been in the business for more than three years now earning her PHP3000 per month.  This is the source of her income. Resyl is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like meat, cooking oil and condiments, rice, ketchup, charcoal, canned sausages, cooking oil, shampoo, detergent and noodles for her store. This loan will enable her to cook more food to sell to her customers. In the future, Resyl hopes to make her business sustainable and increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking oil and condiments, rice, ketchup, charcoal, canned sausages, cooking oil, shampoo, detergent and noodles for her store

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en: Casiana is a producer/ manufacturer of local wine (tuba) and spicy vinegar as her primary business enterprise supported by her loan from Paglaum MPC. She is making goods sales and wants to grab the opportunity for her house repair that she asks a loan to purchase woods, sticks, nails and others for house repair.

loans.use: to purchase woods, sticks, nails and others for house repair.

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is thanking KIVA and its lenders from the bottom of her heart for their tireless support of her business.

She has received numerous loans in the past to help sustain and grow her store. Aside from her store she has a tricycle which her husband drives for public transportation.

Carmen trusts that once again she can avail a 30000 PHP loan to refill her store with essential food and household items such as rice, instant noodles, bread, canned goods, coffee, beverages, etc. which she sells at retail.

Part of the loan will be used for tricycle maintenance. Her store and tricycle means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past five years. Although there are days that her sales is low, she maintains her faith that better days are ahead.

Carmen's simple dreams are for her store to grow and to acquire another tricycle to improve her income. She prays for protection and guidance for her married children and their families.

Every week, Carmen meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.en:
Sabino has plans to renovate his house. Since it's his first home, it is built with woven fiber and now he wants to make walls. Since he doesn't have enough money to buy the materials to build his house, so he is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin. Sabino will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add with his capital to buy the materials such as sand, stone, cement, iron, wood, zinc, etc.

He is very happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin because he can build his own house.

loans.use: to buy sand, stone, cement, iron, wood, zinc, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 45, is a single mother of four girls aged 18, 15, 11 and four. She is the family's only breadwinner and works hard to support her daughters and to ensure they finish school.

For the last eight years Elizabeth has been sewing clothes and other fabrics and selling them across the city.

Her hard work and quality products have enabled her to have a steady stream of clients. She is currently unable to meet demand due to inadequate resources.

Elizabeth is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a sewing machine as well as material. She plans to employ one helper to operate the second machine to improve output and work more efficiently to meet demand.

Her aim is to open a design store in the central business district within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, wool binding, beads, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 39 year old married woman who lives with her three children and spouse in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband owns an electrician shop. He has been troubleshooting electrical components such as water pumps, fans, and other electrical accessories. He has become an experts in his profession.

Nazia want to buy more electrical goods to enhance in her husband's electric shop. For this purpose she is seeking a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy stock such as sockets, bulbs, tube lights, switches and electrical goods for his shop.

Nazia hopes the lenders will help her. She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her husband's electrician shop.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 43-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and their living standards are low. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single earning person - her husband who drives an auto rickshaw.

She wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son as well. He wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total.
Therefore, Tahira wants to receive a loan for her son so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her son, so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family.

She hopes that her son will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional auto rickshaw for her son's occupation to increase earnings.

loans.name: Ruth Anany

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de sastrería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pon cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua  confeccionando  blusas, ternos entre otros para sus distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas ,tijeras entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS (Sweet Name of Jesus). The bank is located in the district of Cusco and department of Cusco.

She continues to work in tailoring business. She is having a good time with her business and it is doing well because of the effort she puts in every day. She continues to tailor blouses, suits and others for her different clients. She wants to continue her work to support her family.

She requests a loan to buy fabric, scissors and others.

loans.use: to buy fabric, scissors and others.

loans.name: Mery Ingrid

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de brosteria, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su comida a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, papas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Sweet Name of Jesus (Dulce Nombre de Jesus). The bank is located in the district of Cusco, and the area of Cusco.
The member continues working in the business of chicken rotisserie. She is grateful for the given loan, and she is committed to meeting the established payments. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She continues selling her food to her clients who ask for it, and in this way she can help her family get ahead.
She asks for a loan to buy chickens and potatoes, among others.

loans.use: to buy chickens and potatoes, among others.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a 58 year old married woman and and mother of six grown children from Matag-ob, Leyte. Faustina runs a small sari-sari or retail store in her place. This is the source of her income for the past 30 years. Faustina is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like candies, bubble gums, peanuts, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, coffee, sugar and snack foods. With this, she will be able to increase her inventories and stock her shelves which will attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Faustina hopes to improve the sustainability and profitability of her store.

loans.use: to buy candies, bubble gums, peanuts, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, coffee, sugar and snack foods

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Estelita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda. He is a forty-two-year-old hardworking, married man with four children.

He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise and also earns extra income from produce buying and selling. His dream is to start up a wholesale shop in the future and to educate his children to university level.

The major challenge he faces is inadequate capital to meet the demand. Benson is in need of a loan to buy sugar, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Sabiniana

texts.en: Sabiniana is 58 years old, married and lives in Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She runs & operates a hog raising business to support the needs of the family. Recently, she asks for a loan to buy piglets for hog raising for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets for hog raising

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon is involved in renovation works in Artik town. He lives with his parents, sister, wife and two little kids.
While receiving orders from locals and providing for them renovation works, Levon perfectly manages to provide high quality work and gather income for his family. He asks this loan to purchase tools and materials for construction works.

Levon has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for construction works

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 32, married and living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her financial condition neither good nor bad, but her husband earns not enough to contribute to household expenses.
He is a carpenter and makes very fine furniture such as wooden beds, chairs, tables, cots etc. He has been running this work since 15 years and has lot of experience.

Recently her husband became sick and most of the savings were spent upon his medical treatment. Now he is healed and hearty but does not have enough money to buy raw materials for making furniture. Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, glue, chip boards etc to continue his business.

She thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and feeling happy after this loan.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, glue and chip boards for her husband's furniture making business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is age of 36 years old and her family consist of seven people including her five children.

She is a good at stitching clothes and wants to increase her stitching work to meet her household expenses.

For this reason Yasmee has to purchase a sewing machine and stitching material, including threads, needles, clothing etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally.

However, due to the lack of money Yasmee is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance in her stitching work.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase onions, cabbages, tomatoes, avocados, bananas, potatoes, etc., for sale.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and ensure that all her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase onions, cabbages, tomatoes, avocados, bananas, potatoes, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Concepcion De Jesus

texts.es:
Concepción, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos que aún viven con ella, ella estudio hasta cuarto grado, su familia era de escasos recursos y desde temprana edad tuvo que trabajar en el negocio familiar, actualmente su negocio es la elaboración de tamales de elote y dulces típicos, vende en las zonas aledañas a su lugar de residencia y este es el principal ingreso de su familia.

Concepción, tiene 12 años de vender tamales y dulces típicos, esta labor fue enseñada por su madre; pero además se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y sus hijos toman parte activa junto a su madre en este trabajo.

Concepción, necesita le préstamo para comprar más materia prima como elote, sal, frutas, dulce de panela, azúcar, etc. para ampliar más su negocio y obtener una mejor ganancia y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.

Concepción, sueña con ampliar su casa y de ser posible construirla de ladrillo, porque donde vive actualmente es de bahareque y las paredes con frecuencia se dañan.
texts.en:
Concepción is a single mother with 4 children who still live with her. She studied until fourth grade. Her family did not have much and, from an early age, she had to work in the family business. She currently makes tamales and sweets that are being sold in the neighboring areas. This is the main income of her family.

It’s been 12 years of selling tamales and sweets. Her mother taught her the trade. She also works in cultivation of basic grains. Her children take an active part in this work.
