Concepción requests a loan to buy more raw materials like corn, salt, fruit, unrefined whole cane sugar, sugar, etc. This will further expand her business and generate better profit so that her family can have a better life.

Concepción dreams of expanding her house possibly built with brick. Her current house is made of wattle and daub and walls are being damaged frequently.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like corn, salt, fruit, unrefined whole cane sugar, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lirije

texts.en:
This is Lirije being photographed in the so-called kitchen, and from its condition one can tell how poorly she and and her family live.

Lirije is a 61-year-old widowed mother of two who lives in an apartment building in a tiny town in northern Albania. She receives a disability income of $140 a month; sometimes, her children who are not any better financially help her. She was living all on her own, until recently when her daughter who has been living in Greece for many years sent her two teen children to live with Lirjie.

With the grandchildren around, she must do some very basic home improvements to improve hygiene and sanitation to the poor little apartment according to her. "My grand kids can't live like that, with no water and toilet inside," said Lirije to the loan officer who worked on the disbursement.

loans.use: to improve hygiene and sanitation for her grandkids.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir needs this loan to build a fence around agricultural land.

"So many times animals have come on the land and destroyed my plants. I've lost money due to this issue. Some villagers don't care let their animals loose at night, and this is the time when they mostly visit my property," says Vladimir.

Vladimir is 46 and a married father of three, with the youngest one being 10 years old.

For the past almost 20 years Vladimir's focus has been on agriculture and livestock. He plants mostly fodder for the animals and some seasonal veggies.

Since his land is not large enough to earn enough income for the family, he works for monthly pay of $250.

loans.use: to build a fence around the agricultural land to keep animals out.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 43-year-old lady living with her spouse and three children in Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to earn enough money to provide a better life for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Shakeela's husband has been driving a motorized rickshaw for several years but his income is insufficient to feed their entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and rickshaw’s but he does not have cash to fix the problem.

Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can maintain his rickshaw. She hopes that she will be able to save enough money to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: to maintain a rickshaw motorbike for her husband's transportation service.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 24-year-old married woman, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible house wife and looks after her family at home. Her husband owns an electronics shop in which he offers LCD and other televisions on retail and on installment plans as well. He sells different brands such as Sony, Samsung, LG, Nobel and Panasonic. He also offers one year warranties for those electronics.

Her husband wants to grow his business and offer more electronics to his customers, but he does not have enough capital for investment. For this reason, Sobia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is a field partner of Kiva. Through this loan, her husband will buy more electronic products to sell.

Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's electronics shop business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is thankful for a number of loans granted to her in the past, for it has helped sustain her direct selling of personal products. She is glad that she was able to go into the food business to augment her income.

Now that it is school time in the Philippines, there are more orders of her personal products. In this regard she needs funds to pay for products such as footwear, underwear, body powder, soap, cosmetics. Part of the loan she will use to buy cooking utensils and ingredients to cook dishes to serve and deliver to her neighbors.

Teodora aims to buy a small truck to deliver food to families in her community. She prays for abundance in all areas of her life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and merchandise.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson a father of six children and is an enterprising man living in Bundibugyo,Uganda.

The responsibility of looking after the family rests solely on him, and his dream is to educate his children up to the university and to also run businesses that will sustain his family and assure them of a good future.

Edson is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa. Delayed payments and unpredictable weather are his greatest challenges, while his desire to buy more land and diversify his farming activities.

Edson is requesting for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 42-year-old farmer who stays in Kagadi, Uganda. A father to five children, he has been doing farming all his life. Specifically, he owns a banana plantation.

Recently, he bought a motorcycle with his savings, which he is using to transport his harvests to the market and also to earn income by transporting passengers. With the money earned, he has been able to pay his children’s school fees and start construction of his residential house.

Charles intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets, doors and windows to finish construction of his house.

In the future, he hopes to buy land and grow other crops like maize and coffee.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, doors and windows to finish construction of his house.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 42 years old married women. She is mother of three sons and two daughters. She has started clothing sale business and wants to support her family through her business.

Noreen purchase a variety of clothes from different areas and sell them at a profitable price in the main market.

Presently Noreen needs to purchase seasonal clothes to sell. Moreover, she also wants to sell crockery because ladies of the town come to her home and she can easily increase her income by selling crockery also.

However due to lack of finance she is facing a problem. Noreen is requested for loan from Kiva and his partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to increase clothing sales and add crockery sales.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim’s age is 49. She is married and lives with her husband and six children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Shamim owns a small clothing-sale business at home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them for high prices in her community. The ladies of town like her clothing collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her efforts.

Now that the winter season is going to start, she wants to buy winter-season clothes to sell, but she does not have the money due to household expenses.

Shamim requested a loan so that she can buy winter-season clothes to fulfill demand.

She wishes for a bright future for her children and dreams of providing them a better education. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal clothing stock for her own clothing-sale business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 46 years old, a married woman and a mother of three children. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting orders on time.

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Salma hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting orders on time.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 46 years old, a married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase-and-sales business. She buys cloth in various fabrics and in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Yasmeen expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Like many women, it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging our client Kaneez to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan. Kaneez is a 32-year-old married woman shown in the photo with her child. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk-selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, age 39, is a mother of four children and they live in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has run a general store that sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Therefore, Azra requested a loan for her husband so he can buy more wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

Azra hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way. Azra thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, chocolates, flour for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Famille Dodos Group

texts.fr: Les revenus générés par le premier crédit a permis à Dodos de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants, d'agrandir son activité et de subvenir aux soins médicaux de la famille. La situation de maladie qui a frappé sa famille a failli handicaper le remboursement du précédent crédit mais en fin de compte Dodos s'est arrangé pour honorer son engagement. Il sollicite un deuxième crédit pour l'entretien de son café.
texts.en:
Dodos is seeking a second loan to maintain his coffee bean field.

The income earned with the help of the first credit helped Dodos to pay his children's tuition fees, to expand his activity and to provide for his family's medical care.

The illness that hit his family at the time threatened the repayment of that first loan, but Dodos ultimately managed to honor his debt.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee bean field.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been running her eatery for three years. She is happily married and had one child.

Jane would like to borrow additional capital of PHP15,000. This amount will be use to buy fish, meat, frozen foods and vegetables.

She knows that having more recipes and good customer service at her eatery will enable her to encourage more customers and gain a better income.

She hopes to keep her eatery profitable and a viable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, frozen foods and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of 55,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizers and seeds.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a nurse. She works and lives in Ejmiatsin town with her three children, husband and mother-in-law.

Anahit provides nursing services from her house. She is nice and profesional with the clients, so people prefer to come to Anahit to have some injections, consultation or medicine.

She asks this loan to purchase medical tools and medicine, and to cover the renovation costs of the room for providing medical services.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for medical tools, medicine, and to cover the renovation costs of the room where she will be providing medical services.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Financial constraints alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her four children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged our Zareena to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Zareena is 47 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 34 years old, a married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community.

Some years ago, she started her business of tailoring along with running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get boost in her earnings.

She wishes to spend the profit on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Binwell

texts.en:
Nachingwa School is one of the few schools in Kaunda square that is trying to improve the way children learn. The inspiration behind Nachingwa School was to offer a quality education to vulnerable children in this community.

It was established in 1993 by Binwell. The school is located in Kaunda Square, a densely populated area in Lusaka, Zambia.

Binwell believes instilling knowledge in children at an early age will help them become excellent members of their communities in future.

Binwell is hoping to get a loan to purchase iSchool ZEduPad tablets to help improve education at Nachingwa School.

The tablets come preloaded with the Zambia National curriculum. It is voiced written and animated which makes it fun for the children to learn and understand lessons using modern technology. This educational tablet is being used in most schools in Zambia and is in other countries around Africa.

loans.use: to purchase ZEduPad tablets for children in his school.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children.

Some years back, she was hardly managing her household activities with the small income of her husband. Then, through loans from Kashf Foundation, she initiated her business of hand embroidery.

Tasleem is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads and frames to meet her customers' orders on time to earn a good amount of profit. This monetary help can take Tasleem closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads and frames to meet her customers' orders on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 56 yeas old and a widow; she is shown in the photo with her son. She works in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment; this will allow her to cater consistently to more customers. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment to cater consistently to more customers.

loans.name: Kalsa

texts.en:
Kalsa is a 34-year-old married woman. She has had a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many procedures to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

She needs to treat more customers at a time. That is why she has applied a for loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straighteners, make-up kits and cleansers for treating many customers at a time.

She is very experienced in her business and confident that it will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, make up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses.

Manzooran is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business.

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 55,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as different color thread, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.

She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such different color thread, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS.
La  socia Paulina continua con su negocio de venta de pasto, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo el pasto a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia  lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de pasto.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This is a member of the community bank Dulce Nombre de Jesus.

Paulina is still going with her grass selling business, selling to customers that order from her. She's a responsible and hardworking person who has been at this business for a long time. It's gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day, and this business is how she supports her family. 

She applied for a loan to purchase grass, and is grateful for the loan and is committed to sticking to the agreed upon payments.

loans.use: To purchase grass

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is a retail shop. She has been in the business for four years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase mattresses, flour and sugar to sell.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses, flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 62 years old. She is married and has five children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 13 years. She earns a monthly income of 37,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

She will use the profits from the business to reinvest in the business in order to expand it. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Emelina

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, está casada, tiene una hija que está estudiando y su esposo trabaja como motorista de camiones pesados y también realizan cultivos de granos básicos. 

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años, además posee una tienda que junto a su hija se encargan de atender, las labores agrícolas son parte indispensable en la familia y en esa actividad solo se dedica su esposo, sus labores las inicia a las 5:00 a.m. y termina hasta las 6:00 p.m. 

Rosa, utilizará el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, foliar y maíz. con el préstamo se le estara ayudando porque podrá adquirir los productos a un costo más bajo, debido a que comprara mayor cantidad.

Rosa, desea tener un negocio más grande y tener al menos una empleada y tener mejores oportunidades para el desarrollo profesional de su hija.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and is married. She has a daughter who is studying and her husband works driving heavy trucks and also grows basic grains.

Rosa has worked selling tortillas for 10 years. She also has a store that she takes care of together with her daughter. Farming is an indispensable part of the family and only her husband works in this activity. He starts his work at 5:00 a.m. and finishes at 6:00 p.m.

Rosa will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs like manure, foliar spray and corn. The loan will help as she can acquire the products at a lower price as she is buying in greater quantity.

Rosa wants to have bigger business and have at least one employee and have better opportunities for the professional development of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like manure, foliar spray and corn.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, a 39-year-old entrepreneur who is engaged in a variety store business in her community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo.

She sells various commodities that are essential to the everyday living of the people in her area. Her inventory includes sachets of toiletries, snacks, candies, bread, repacked condiments, canned goods, beverages, and many others.

She and her husband, Arlie, a farmer, work diligently to raise their child who is in high school. Basically, they earn enough to provide for their basic needs but there are times that it’s not sufficient.

Gemma is not content to just make a daily living because she aspires to save more for the future. With this forward-looking mindset, she wants to make her business more profitable.

She would like a loan amounting to PhP 15,000 to buy more quantities of dry goods and beverages for her store. She is hoping that additional income from this loan will sustain their everyday needs, boost her savings, and ensure the college education of her child. It can also cover the long time debts of her customers.

She is looking forward to developing her store into a mini-grocery someday. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of dry goods and beverages for her store

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Surrounded with poor financial circumstances, Perveen needed to start her own business to increase her purchasing power.

She is 48 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 38 years old, a divorced woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trading. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Shehnaz has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen’s son owns a metal shop in which he sells iron's sheets and rods in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son has been selling iron's rods, uses for constructing concrete roofs and manufacturing iron accessories. He has been involved in this business since childhood.

He wants to educate and feed his sibling in a good manners and needs to generate maximum income so he can support his family.

For the sake of his family's future he wants to increase his inventory but he does not have cash in hand.

Parveen, age 52, is a mother of four children; she has to look after her children in old age. She wants to financial support her son.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy metal rods and sheets for her son's metal goods selling shop.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 36-year-old, hardworking woman who has 2 children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching.

Balqees ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

She has requested a loan amount 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Khursheeda

texts.en:
Khursheeda is a 54 year old lady who lives with her spouse and five children in Lahore, Pakistan.

She is the responsible mother; her children go to school. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw and wants to buy an additional rickshaw.

He has savings but not enough to buy another rickshaw. Khursheeda has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy another rickshaw.

Khursheeda thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for her husband transportation business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. She maintains her household activities properly.

She has been running a beauty parlor for the last eight years. She is a well-trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day.

Now she requires some beauty parlor related items such as facial creams and combs, as well as furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc.

Asia made contact with the Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan. BRAC staff visited her enterprise and issued the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders as well.

loans.use: to buy some of the latest beauty parlor-related items for her own business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant mas grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar,aceite, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Margarita is still working at her grocery store & restaurant business. She's an enterprising, hardworking woman whose dream is to have a bigger restaurant. She's applying for a loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, and cookies.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Variety store and hog raising business has been Betty's primary source of income. She is a single mother with four children.

Betty is thankful that she is able to sustain her family basic needs through her business.

According to her, two of her children attend school and that's the reason why she's doing her best to improve her business and generate greater income.

With Betty's determination to help her family, she is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as milk, sugar, canned goods and bags (made in Baguio) to sell.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus owns a pub. He comes from Nyabikamba, and is married with eight children. He is burdened with high family expenses, especially school fees and their related expenses.

He is requesting a loan of ugx1,000,000 to assist him in paying school fees for his children.

The challenge he faces is competition in the area, since there are other many bars in the area.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 35 years old. He is married and has 2 children. He runs a retail shop and has been in this business for 3 years.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and he will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, rice, and detergents to sell and make more profits to support his family.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children and expand his business even more by buying more goods to sell.

His future hopes and dreams are to grow his business and open a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, rice, and detergents to sell and make more profits to support his family.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 58 years old married woman and mother of three sons and three daughters. She lives with her family in the area of Rawalpindi.

Shameem has started a clothing sale business and wants to support her family.

Shameem purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market.

Presently Shameem needs to purchase clothes to sell. However due to lack of finance she needs a loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.
La socia MARIA  sigue trabajando en una empresa pública, la socia es una persona responsable y emp0eñosa,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales , la socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otros.
texts.en:
This is a member of the community bank "Comuzone"; She lives in the city of Cusco in the Huanchac district, a subdivision of Cusco. Maria is still working for a state-owned company. She's a responsible, hard-working person who has been at her job for a long time and feels personally fulfilled there, and this work is how she supports her family. 

She is grateful for and values the support provided by this organization and is committed to making the loan payments within the established time frame. She applied for a loan to purchase supplies for her home such as rice, sugar, and milk among other things.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her home such as rice, sugar, and milk among other things.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia Clorinda se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Clorinda continues to work in her business, a grocery store. She sells basic food items like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8 am until 7 pm. She has run her business for 5 years and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.

Clorinda is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of her installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Manuel Enrique

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Manuel  continua  trabajando para una institución pública, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un electrodoméstico.
texts.en:
Manuel is a member of the "Comuzone II" communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.  

Manuel continues to work for a public institution.  He has had this job for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day.  He wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.  

He thanks those who are a part of this dream, and he is committed to making his installation payments.

He is requesting a loan to buy a home appliance.

loans.use: to buy a home appliance.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is from Gavar town where he lives with his wife and two children. Vardan has been involved in providing the technical maintenance of cars for 6 years. He works in a garage near his house and he is a very hard working and nice person who receives a number of clients during the month.

Vardan applied for this loan to be able to cover some very important operational costs for his business. He plans to purchase tools for his auto repair service and renovate the garage where he works.

Vardan has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools for his auto repair service and renovate his garage.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, who is 32 years old, is from the Kharagauli district. She is married and has six members-family.

They have small agribusiness and get social assistance from local government, as the family lives in poverty.

Tamar has a fixed salary of 250 GEL, and it is really hard to meet even basic need of her family.

She has a great desire to help her family. Tamar requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. With the loan she will purchase and sell clothing in her community with price mark-ups.

Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo.

The loan will be of great support to her family, as her income will be significantly increased. Tamar is very thankful and will make a better living condition for her children.

The startup loan program helps the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and lack of access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram sells fruits and vegetables in nearby region of Gegharquniq town.

He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 12.

Aram, using his own truck, sells fruits and vegetables in different markets.

He asks for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk.

Aram has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Aram is very grateful to receive lenders' support, as the loan will improve his current business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mammadaga

texts.en:
Mammadaga is a 48 years old, married refugee and father of one son.

He is an honest, hard-working, successful merchant who sells items like food and clothes.

Mammadaga wants to grow his business and buy new more items to sell to help his family. He needs Kiva ]lenders’ support.

loans.use: to grow his business and buy new more materials to sell.

loans.name: Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Baraka is in his late 20's and single with no children. He has been running two businesses in motorcycle spare parts and also in a motorcycle transportation business for seven years now. He works from 6am to 7pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Baraka's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to open a spare parts for motorcycle shop and serviced his motorcycle. He has paid back all his loans successfully.

He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing great. He used the profit to buy a plot of land, for loan repayments, to reinvest in business, he built his house and covered his household expenses.

He will use this loan to increase his business. He dreams of owning a car and opening another business location.

Baraka will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to use for expanding his business, such as increasing the stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen owns and operates an agricultural farm, growing coconuts, bananas and other crops for a living. Belen has been engaged in this business for many  years, with her husband working on it, and earns well from these activities. Her  farm is  doing well and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan to pay for labor costs in harvesting the coconuts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in harvesting the coconuts.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson es un comerciante de bebidas residente en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias que heredó de su madre este negocio, tras su fallecimiento el continuó con esta actividad desde las instalaciones de su vivienda en donde tiene un enfriador con capacidad para guardar canastastas de diferentes tipos de bebidas; gaseosas, jugos naturales y cervezas, que vende a sus vecinos y conocidos del sector. Todos los días de la semana a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. está disponible para despachar a sus clientes la bebida de su preferencia, aunque los fines de semana son los días de mayor flujo de personal.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir surtido de bebidas y continuar sin inconvenientes en su labor.  Wilson desea que su negocio se mantenga estable con el pasar del tiempo.
texts.en:
Wilson is a vendor of drinks who resides in a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias. He inherited the business from his mother. After her passing away he continued this activity from the facilities in his house. He has a cooler with the capacity to store crates of different types of drinks; soft drinks, natural juices and beer which he sells to his neighbors and acquaintances in the area. He is open every day of the week from 7 am until 9 pm and is ready to sell his clients their favorite drinks. The weekends are the days with most customers.

He is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan he has made through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in a variety of drinks and continue with his business with no disruption. Wilson wants his business to remain stable with the passing of time.

loans.use: to invest in a variety of drinks.

loans.name: Dúo Elim Group

texts.es:
DUO ELIM
Este dúo formado por doña  Marta Olivia, de  30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijas, desde hace 14 años aproximadamente es negociante, vendiendo ropa típica nueva y usada, también vende pollo frito y papas fritas los fines de semana en casa de sus padres, también hace costuras cuando le piden, es una mujer trabajadora y solicita este crédito porque le han pedido güipiles de Cobán para uniforme de práctica y no tiene suficiente capital para invertir, espera el apoyo de fape y kiva para poder comprar lo que le han pedido, quiere mejorar su carreta de pollo que ya se está deteriorando, y espera poder lograrlo con el crédito que se le otorgue.
texts.en:
Marta Olivia is a member of Duo Elim.  She is 30 years old, married, and has 2 daughters.  She has been a businesswoman for 14 years, selling new and used traditional clothing.  She also sells fried chicken and french fries on the weekends from her parents' home, and does sewing work when she gets orders.  

She is a hard-working woman and she is requesting this loan because she someone has put in an order from her for güipiles de Cobán (garments made from traditional Maya textiles from the Coban area) for practice uniforms and she doesn't have enough money to make this investment.  She hopes that she can count on the support of FAPE and Kiva to fill her orders.  She also wants to improve her chicken cart that is falling apart, and she hopes that she will be able to use the provided loan to do that.

loans.use: to buy new traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia Dionicia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz y tambien al negocio de crianza de animales, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Dionicia continues making a living selling basic dried grains such as corn and wheat, as well as raising animals.  She wants to get ahead through her business.  Her dream is to expand her grain business.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn, barley, and wheat.  

She is happy to receive this loan and she is committed to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, and wheat.

loans.name: Solis

texts.es: Solis es un emprendedor de Arjona un municipio de Bolívar y cuenta con una amplia experiencia en la comercialización de carnes frías, actividad que inició al recibir la propuesta de un proveedor, cuando laboraba con un hermano en una tienda de verduras, de este modo consideró que sería una oportunidad para independizarse y que los resultados de este proyecto dependerían exclusivamente de él.  Hoy en día cuenta con siete años ofreciendo a las tiendas del municipio una excelente variedad de embutidos; salchichas, mortadelas, salchichón, jamones y demás productos que distribuye a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Solis vende gran parte de sus productos de contado, sin embargo otorga créditos a sus clientes y como su capital no le es suficiente para su demanda está aplicando a un credikiva, con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en mucho más surtido de carnes frías y así podrá abastecer a las tiendas del municipio sin inconvenientes.  Su meta a futuro es tener un negocio más grande y adecuar un local.  Su meta familiar es continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su cónyuge e hijos y garantizarles una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Solis is an entrepreneur from Arjona, a municipality in Bolívar, and he has a wide experience selling cold cuts.

He used to work with his brother at a fruit and vegetable store, and, on the suggestion of one of the store's suppliers, he launched his charcuterie business. Solis thought that it would be a good opportunity to become self-employed and that the results of this business project would depend exclusively on him.

For seven years now, he has been offering the stores in the municipality a wide variety of cold cuts such as sausage, mortadella, salami-type sausage, ham, and other products, which he distributes from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Most of his sales are paid in cash; however, he lets his customers buy his products on credit.

Because he doesn't have enough capital to fulfill the demand, he is asking the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan to buy a larger assortment of cold cuts. With this purchase, he'll be able to supply the stores in the municipality without any problems.

His goal is to expand his business and set up a store.

His family goal is to continue to provide for his wife and children, and to ensure that the latter have an excellent education.

loans.use: to purchase a larger assortment of cold cuts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la señora se dedica a la venta de comida (changa de pollo los días sábados, fricase los días domingos, puchero los días lunes, en una plazuela concurrida de la ciudad, tiene 22 de edad y una experiencia de 3 años en la actividad de venta de comida, trabaja solo los días mencionados y estudia de martes a viernes para poder tener una profesión, desde muy jóvenes ella y su hermano tuvieron que trabajar ya que su señora madre se fue al exterior y no les ayuda económicamente y su señor padre es de profesión militar y siempre está destinado en otros departamentos, el motivo de la presente solicitud de préstamo es para poder pagar la operación de su hermano menor el cual está postulando al colegio militar de aviación ya que este es un sueño personal que él tiene, y según exámenes médicos necesita una operación para corregir astigmatismo la cual no es muy riesgosa pero no cuentan con el efectivo disponible en este momento y el viaje de su hermano será en los próximos meses para la postulación esta es el argumento de la señora sobre la situación de su hermano.
texts.en:
This lady sells food: chicken chimichangas on Saturdays, fricassee on Sundays, and stew on Mondays, in a busy city square. She is 22 years old and has three years of experience in food selling. She works only on the days listed above and studies from Tuesdays to Fridays in order to be able to have a professional career.

Since she was very young she and her brother had to work since their mother had gone abroad and did not help them financially, and their father has a military profession and is always stationed in other areas. The reason for this loan request is to pay for the operation of her younger brother, who is applying to the military aviation school, which is a personal dream he has. According to his medical examinations he needs surgery to correct astigmatism, which is not very risky but they do not have the cash available at this time, and her brother will travel in the coming months for his military evaluation.

This is the story by the lady about her brother's situation

loans.use: to pay for her younger brother’s operation, which is very expensive, so that her brother can realize the career of his dreams.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and animal feeds. 

She will use the profits from her expanded business to improve the standard of living of her family. 

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and have a stable future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and animal feeds.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar has been involved in selling fruits and vegetables for 2 years already.

Using his own truck, he sells fruit and vegetable products in nearby regions of Arapi Village. Mkhitar lives with his mother, wife and three grown up sons who support him with his business. Mkhitar asks this loan to pay for renovating his truck and to purchase vegetables to sell in bulk.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Mkhitar hopes to receive the support of lenders and to continue developing his business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his truck and to purchase vegetables to sell in bulk.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando es un empresario independiente de 41 años de edad, habitante de Suba una localidad al noroccidente de Bogotá, geográficamente, el territorio presenta zonas verdes, sobre todo en los cerros de Suba, en este mismo lugar, Armando tiene una parcela de vaca lecheras, actividad que heredó de su familia y que abastece de este producto a recolectoras de leche.  Él aprovecho la riqueza de su región para emprender su microempresa y adicionalmente labora con una empresa privada ejerciendo funciones de guardia de seguridad.  En la actualidad desea ampliar la capacidad de su negocio y necesita comprar más ganado, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una novilla para a futuro generar más leche e incrementar sus ingresos.  Él está separado de su cónyuge y es padre de cuatro hijos menores de edad a quienes ofrece bienestar con los frutos de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Armando is a 41 year old independent businessman. He lives in Suba a place to the Northeast of Bogota. Geographically the territory offers green spaces especially in the Suba Mountains. Armando has a plot of land here with milk cows, a business he inherited from his family that supplies products from collecting the milk. He took advantage of the richness of the region to start his micro-enterprise and he also works in a private company in the capacity of a security guard.

He currently wants to expand the capacity of his business and he needs to buy more cattle. So he is applying for his first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in the purchase of a calf which in the future will produce more milk and increase his revenues. He is separated from his spouse and is the father of four minor children whom he provides well-being with the fruits of his labor.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a calf.

loans.name: Mti Muzuri Group

texts.fr: Appris de leurs parents, la plupart de membres du groupe MTI MUZURI ont quelques cinq ans d'expérience dans la culture du riz. cette activité les permet de subvenir tant soit peu aux besoins familiaux. Pour Faradey, président  du groupe, l'insuffisance de fonds est un élément déterminant sur son rendement. ce crédit l'aidera à prendre en charge certains travaux champêtres tels que l'achat de produits phytosanitaires et le paiement de la main d'œuvre. Il espère atteindre une meilleure production si toutes les conditions requises de la riziculture sont mises en œuvre. Sur photo, Faradey tient un carnet rose.
texts.en:
Most of the Mti Muzuri Group's members have some five years of experience growing rice, having learned from their parents. This cultivation will allow them to support their families' needs, even the slightest bit.

For them, insufficient funds are a key element that determines their yield. However, they hope that the loan will help them to achieve a better output if all of the necessary requirements for rice growing are implemented.

Faraday is the president of the group and has a red notebook in the photograph.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy crop protection products.

loans.name: Elcin

texts.en: Elcin is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives in the Bilasuvar region. He is 38 years old, and at this young age is very energetic and passionate. He is married and has two children. Currently he is working as a hairdresser and is a very good and sociable person. Elcin loves his job but he has some problems. One of them is Elcin’s salon doesn’t belong to him. His biggest desire is to own a hairdresser salon. He wants to buy a small hairdresser salon and expand it with time. For all of this, Elcin first must rent a place; therefore he needs some money for rent and to buy some hairdresser equipment.

loans.use: to rent a place and to buy some hairdresser equipment.

loans.name: Yacmel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEII, el socio continua trabajando para una empresa pública en el ares de administración, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de vivieres para su hogar como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to communal bank COMUZONE II and continues to work for a state-owned company in the area of administration. The member is a responsible and diligent person who has done his job for some time. It gives him personal satisfaction, amongst other things, and allows the member to provide for his family.

The member is applying for a loan in order to buy household goods such as rice, sugar, milk and other things. The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling the repayments

loans.use: to buy household goods such as rice, sugar, milk and other things.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cristina continua  trabajando en una agencia de turismo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de paquetes que le solicitan sus clientes, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de boletos y entradas.
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank "COMUZONE." She lives in the city of Cusco, in the district of Huanchac, in the Cusco region.

Cristina is still working in a travel agency. She is a responsable and diligent person and sells different kinds of packages that her clients ask her for, which is how she supports her family. She is asking for this loan so she can buy tickets for transportation and for shows.

She is grateful and appreciates the assistance provided and she promises to pay her loan back in the established time.

loans.use: to buy tickets for transportation and for shows.

loans.name: Lencer

texts.en: Lencer is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for and harvesting to earning an income as well. Pedrita has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a good farmer, Pedrita has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Pedrita hopes to purchase more rice-land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to venture into retailing. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Roger feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business.

Recently, he availed a loan to restock his sari-sari store with basic commodities. Roger wishes to sustain his business and be able to support his family.

loans.use: to restock his sari-sari store with basic commodities

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has started her small-time business and became a boss of her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and increase her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only store in her barangay.

Recently, she approached Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities, such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, and other items.

In the future, she hopes to provide a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, and other items.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en: Tarcela, married with adult-age children, is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines where she has been growing rice to earn a living for 30 years. A member of PMPC for seven years, Tarcela is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies. In the future, Tarcela hopes to expand her farming activities by purchasing another parcel of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Darling Del Carmen

texts.es: Darling es una estilista profesional que reside en Cartagena de Indias un municipio del Departamento de Bolívar y que lleva en esta actividad siete años.  Ella tomó una capacitación en este arte y con el apoyo de su cónyuge compró las herramientas necesarias para ofrecer sus servicios a domicilio.  Sus clientes están ubicados en el perímetro de la ciudad y acuerdan citas para realizar servicios de corte de cabello, cepillado, tintes, desrizado, iluminaciones, limpiezas faciales entre otros tratamientos que estén a la vanguardia como queratinas, repolarización, y chocolaterapias. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en insumos de peluquería y tratamientos de belleza para realizar sus trabajos a todo costo. Su meta a futuro es aperturar su sala de belleza y poder compartir más con sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Darling is a professional stylist who lives in Cartagena de Indias, a town located in the department of Bolívar.  She has been a stylist for 7 years.  

She completed a training course in the art of styling, and she bought the necessary tools with the support of her partner to offer her services door-to-door.  Her customers are located around the perimeter of the city and they make appointments for hair cutting, brushing, dying, straightening, highlights, and facial cleaning services, among other cutting-edge treatments such as keratin, depolarization, and choco-therapy.  

Presently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will invest the loan in hair salon supplies and beauty treatments to carry out her work at all cost.  Her future dream is to open a beauty salon and to be able to share more with her two children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon and beauty treatments.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is a self-employed hairdresser from Goris town. She is the mother of one daughter and she does her best to provide good living conditions. Lena has been doing hairdressing for 10 years and, over those hard and tiring work years, she has been able to collect a loyal client base. 

Lena is requesting a loan to purchase tools and materials needed for her salon business. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International that provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials needed for her hairdressing business

loans.name: Francisca Estela

texts.es: Francisca de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca, 46 years old, lives in her own home with her husband. She has been working for several years preparing and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home, and she has many customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn in hundred-pound quantities and lime, to continue making tortillas. That way, she will have better income to have a better quality of life.

she is requesting a loan for quintals buying corn and lime to continue making tortillas so we can have better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn in hundred-pound quantities, and lime

loans.name: Surgidores - El Tambo Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Surgidores - El Tambo” y está formado por 09 integrantes responsables. Hipolita de 49 años de edad es casada con 04 hijos. Hipolita se dedica a la Agricultura. Desde muy joven se dedica  a la agricultura junto a su familia, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su siembra. El deseo de Hipolita es tener un puesto en el mercado para así vender sus productos de la siembra. El grupo “Surgidores - El Tambo” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de conseguir sus metas. Hipolita es la tercera a la mano derecha del grupo con una chompa roja y casaca crema.
texts.en:
The "Surgidores- El Tambo" Group is made up of 9 responsible members.  Hipolita is 49 years old and married, with 4 children.  She makes a living farming.  She farmed alongside her family from a very young age.  Thanks to her constant dedication, she is able to give her family a better quality of life.  

She requested this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.  She wants to have a place in the market to sell the produce that she plants.  The "Surgidores- El Tambo" Group thanks Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to achieve their goals.  Hipolita is pictured third from the right with a red sweater and cream-colored jacket.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 38 years old and married with two children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar region. For the past ten years, Ramil has been a farmer. He has a lot of experience, but currently he is not happy about the situation of his farm. Due to a water shortage, Ramil cannot earn enough income. He needs money to buy a water tank.

Ramil is requesting a 1,200 AZN loan to buy a water tank, fertilizer, and garden tools to improve his business. He loves his family and knows that, with a growing and expanded business, he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water tank, fertilizer, and tools

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She runs a tailoring business that has been profitable. 

Mary is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. This will be her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully repaid her previous loan. Mary hopes her loan will enable her to make more clothes to sell and increase her income to support her family. She will use the profits from her loan to pay school fees for her children. Mary’s future hopes and dreams are to expand her tailoring business and make it successful.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is 53 years old and a mother of six adult children. She is used to farming rice since having her family. This has been their source of livelihood together with the small sari-sari store that she operates.

Estelita is in need of additional funds to restock her store to attract more customers. She requested a loan of PHP 5000 to be used in buying fertilizer, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, shampoo, detergent and milk.

The extra income that she can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption, savings and business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, toothpaste, coffee,  sugar, shampoo, detergent and milk.

loans.name: Fidencia

texts.en:
Fidencia is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for seven years now. This is the source of her income. Since she needs to wait for four months before she can have her harvest, she would like have another alternative business. Fidencia plans to start a barbecue business.

Fidencia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, skewers, meat, soy sauce and charcoal. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, improve her harvest and yield and also earn on a daily basis through the barbecue.

In the future, Fidencia hopes to make her businesses more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, skewers, meat, soy sauce and charcoal.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 35 year old lady and a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own shoe business for the past 10 years.

Abida's husband needs to purchase different types of imported and brand name shoes for his business. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill her husband's needs husband Abida has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for business purposes. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him in fulfilling his family's needs

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her husband's shoe business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
This member belongs to the IMASUMAC I Communal Bank. The Bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. The member is Ms. Luz Marina.

Luz Marina alternates her daily activities between making various types of woven/knit products like sweaters, scarves, and others, to fill the orders placed by her customers. She has been working in this business for a while, and it's going well for her, thanks to the dedication that she puts in every day to her business. She makes sweaters to sell to her customers, including friends, relatives, and other people.

She hopes to continue working and thus continue supporting her family. She feels grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling all the payments. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase wool, thread, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase wool, thread, and other items.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 38 years old and married with two children. Alex buys and sells agricultural products, especially dry beans, corn and coffee.

It is coffee season and he wants to buy more stock so that he can sell it at a profit. He will also use a small portion of the loan to buy organic manure for his own coffee plantation in order to increase his yields, sales and profit in the long run.

His major problem is the drought that affected the seedlings and his harvest is low.

He is appreciative of Kiva's support and partnership.

loans.use: to buy coffee for trade.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 30 years old, married and has five children.

She has been in the business of farming for 19 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase the farm inputs of fertilizer and seed..

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Damaris' dreams are to establish her family and stabilize financially.

loans.use: to purchase the farm inputs of fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is a 34-year-old married father of 3 children, who works hard to support his family. He is a customs official working on the border and his wife is housewife. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their daughter's education. This loan of 1,000 USD will allow Jose to help his daughter graduate from senior high school and enter university. Jose will use the loan to pay for his daughter's registration, textbooks, and school supplies. In the future, he hopes that his children are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is 36 years old. She is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region.

Sona is a merchant. She is an intelligent and determined woman. She started this work 10 years ago. In her village everybody knows Sona and loves her. Now she needs some funds for increasing her living standard and to buy new clothes material. Sona is thankful for Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: improve her living standard and buy new clothes material.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a sari-sari store owner from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been running this business for 30 years, while her husband works hard as a driver. They work together proficiently to earn a living.

Gregoria is a 61-year-old woman who dreams of improving her livelihood to have a better means of living. She is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy stocks such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, flour, powdered chocolate drink and milk, chips, candies, bread, laundry soap and toiletries.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, flour, powdered chocolate drink and milk, chips, candies, bread, laundry soap and toiletries

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona and her family live a simple home in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of four children ages 18, 15, 8 and 3 years old. Her husband is a skilled worker while Jona is engaged in the hog raising business. She has been doing this for two years. She also sells food as well as raising pigs, to enhance their livelihood.

Jona is 41 years old and plans to improve her businesses in the future to be able to send her children to college. She dreams for them to finish their studies. As for now, she is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and feed for them. She also plans to buy ingredients for her food selling business such as flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed as well as flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 44 years old, married and has two children.

Her businesses are a retail shop and poultry keeping. She has been in business for three years.

She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase detergent, rice , flour, bread, salt and sugar for selling.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, rice , flour, bread, salt and sugar etc. for selling.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old, and married with one child. She sells used clothes and has been in the business for 6 years. She earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy bags, shirts, dresses and trousers for sale. She hopes this will enable her to make more income to educate her children. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business, make more income and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy bags, shirts, dresses and trousers for sale to make more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran is a 22-year-old married man. He is IDP (Internally displaced person) with living his family in Bilasuvar region. He is a farmer and at the same time works as a hawker.

Tehran wants to buy different fruit trees and sell the fruit at the market. He is sensitive to human welfare which is why he grows organic fruit. Plus, in Azerbaijan, people prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens because they are naturally raised and cheaper. People know that such products are always fresh and healthy and they are not grown with different pesticides and are not harmful.

With many years of experience, Tehran knows how to meet customer demand. His biggest dream is to expand his land and to buy some seed for planting. But, for this, Tehran needs some funds. With this loan he will purchase more land and sow more seeds. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to expand his land and to buy some seed for planting.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar, age 49, is a responsible mother and is living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her third loan with BRAC - she is long-time member and has been taking loans according to the needs of her family.

She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all their household expenses with poor earnings. Her husband is a hawker by profession and sells all kinds of hair oils by bicycle. He sells mustard oil, avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, safflower oil etc. He calls in the streets loudly to the consumers to offer all these hair oils; he is famous for protecting hair from falling out. He wants to buy a large quantity of hair oil to sell for the growth of his business and to overcome their poverty. Therefore, Gulzar has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy more quantity of hair oil on daily basis. Gulzar is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of hair oil for her husband's hair oil selling business.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio Adrian se sigue dedicando al negocio de seguridad en un hotel, el socio por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia, el sueño del socio es tener una tienda de abarrotes como negocio propio. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar una cocina para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Adrian continues working in hotel security, and supports his family with this job. His dream is to have a business of his own, a grocery store. He's applying for a loan to purchase a stove for his kitchen.
