He's happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase a stove for his home.

loans.name: Manuel Felipe

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Manuel  sigue  trabajando para una institución pública, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, el socio dese poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico.
texts.en:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Manuel  sigue  trabajando para una institución pública, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, el socio dese poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico.

This is a member of the community bank "Comuzone II", a bank located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.

Manuel continues to work for a state-owned company, and is applying for a loan to purchase supplies for his household such as rice, sugar, and milk among other things. He's been at his job for a long time and it has given him personal fulfillment, and more. He wants to continue working so that he can keep supporting his family.

He's applying for a loan to purchase an appliance.

loans.use: To purchase an appliance.

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
La socia Yoni se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yoni is still raising animals for a living, she breeds guinea pigs and chickens, and through this work she wants to set up a grocery store because her dream is to have a business of her own. She also wants to have a more spacious location for selling her animals.

She's applying for a loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and also feed for the animals. She's happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase guinea pigs and chickens and also feed for the animals.

loans.name: Sarwat

texts.en:
Sarwat, 45, is a married housewife who looks after her family, which includes her three children. She is an expert tailor who provides services to those who frequent her home business.

Sarwat needs a new sewing machine and a variety of materials such as thread, needles, fabric, etc. While these supplies are very important if she is to continue her work efficiently and professionally, she finds buying these difficult due to her lack of capital. So Sarwat is requesting a 50,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Sarwat is very thankful for Kiva's and its partner Brac Pakistan’s assistance.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a variety of materials such as thread, needles, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 33 years old. He is married and has three children.

His business is farming. He has been in the business for 12 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 (Kenya shillings). This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

Jackson will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve production.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve production.

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga is 55 years old, married, and has six children. He is a farmer, which he has been doing for 20 years. He earns a month income of 15,000 KES.

Mutunga requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve production. He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to have a happy family and successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Gelis Del Carmen

texts.es: Gelis es una microempresaria que recibió formación en tejidos una actividad que siempre le gustó y desde su infancia tuvo sus primeras clases puesto que su madre sabía este arte. Gerlis también era apasionada por el comercio y cuando llegó Cartagena en compañía de sus hijos oriunda de Magangué, inició una minitienda en su lugar de residencia  en la que ofrece un variado surtido de alimentos no perecederos, productos de aseo, golosinas y refrescos, así mismo aprovecho la afluencia de clientes que visitan su negocio para promover las artesanías y accesorios que elabora; binchas, tejidos, adornos y manualidades, los cuales realiza por encargos de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materiales para sus artesanías, accesorios para mujer, productos de belleza y de aseo.  Con esta inversión podrá abastecerse de materias primas que respalden su producción y que apoyen a las venta con un nuevo surtido de productos que exhibe en su negocio.  Su meta a futuro es arreglar el local y ampliar la gama de productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Gelis is a small business owner who trained in knitting, an activity that she always enjoyed and had her first classes when she was a child, since her mom was familiar with this art. Gerlis is also excited about business and when she arrived in Cartagena accompanied by her children, from her native Magangue, she set up a tiny shop in her home where she sells an assortment of non-perishable foods, cleaning products, sweets and soft drinks.

She capitalized on the affluence of the customers that visited her shop by promoting crafts and accessories of her own making; hairbands, knitted fabrics, decorations, and handicrafts, which she makes for her customers to order. Currently she's applying for a credikiva, the first financing that she has sought from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase materials for her crafts, women's accessories, and beauty and hygiene products.

With this investment she'll be able to stock raw materials to shore up her production and boost sales with a new assortment of products to display at her shop. Her goal in the future is to fix up the location and expand the variety of products that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as crafts, women's accessories, and beauty and hygiene products.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is an ambitious married woman with children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a salon as her main source of income. She also does decoration and agriculture as well. Through these sources, Margret's family never lacks the basics. She is a very strategic woman who envisions herself owning a beauty parlor in the next few years. However, inadequate capital and lack of modern equipment hinders her path to achieving her vision. Margret intends to use the loan to buy mirrors, hair relaxing chemicals, and dryers for her salon.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, hair relaxing chemicals, and dryers for her salon.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 32-year-old man who does domestic work for a living.  He goes fishing.   Rolando  lives in his own home with his six children. His eldest child is 13 while the youngest is 2. Aside from fishing, he also grows seaweed for supplemental income.
Rolando is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like nylon and materials like straw for seaweed farming.  This will allow him to improve his livelihood and continue to support the needs of his family.
In the future he is hoping that he could put-up a sari-sari (variety) store to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy nylon and materials for fishing and straw for seaweed farming

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a simple housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her six sons and four daughters, who are studying. Her brother has been running his own business selling old clothes for 12 years. Razia's brother needs to purchase different types of old clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her brother is unable to purchase these old clothes. Therefore Razia is applying for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her brother in purchasing these old clothes in bulk for his business. Her brother can then increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her brother in increasing his used clothing business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old Palestinian driver who works and lives in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. His wife is unemployed and his daughter will be going to school this year. Mohammad started working as a bus driver 10 years ago right after graduating from school. His father is a bus driver too. Mohammad’s clients quickly increased in number as he is known for being punctual, reliable, and friendly. Apart from his bus, which he uses for trips and students, he also owns three other cars that he rents for extra income. 

Mohammad is requesting a 3,341,984 LBP loan to add a new car to his fleet. This will be his first loan from the Kiva partner Ibdaa. Mohammad will use his loan to earn more money that he will use to finance his daughter’s school expenses starting next month.

loans.use: to buy a new car and rent it as a taxi

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 53 years old. She is married and has six children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for nine years.

She earns a monthly income of 26,000 KES. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a healthy, educated family and a financially stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla, 50, is from Silang, Cavite in the Philippines. She is married to Romeo and the couple has children.

For the past three years Luzvilla’s husband has had a tricycle transport operation. Regular maintenance is necessary for a tricycle’s efficient and safe service, so Luzvilla has applied for another 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CCT to pay for new tires plus oil changes and tune-ups for her two tricycles. She hopes to acquire one more tricycle to improve the couple’s income.

Luzvilla wants to see all of her children finish college, as it is her hope that a good education will be her children’s path to a better future. She wants to thank CCT and Kiva from the bottom of her heart for their untiring spiritual and financial support of her transportation business.

All CCT community clients such as Luzvilla are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to pay for new tires plus oil changes and tune-ups for her two tricycles.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 43 years old. She is married and has three children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 14 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 40,000 (Kenya shillings).

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer, chemicals, and seeds.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer, chemicals, and seeds.

loans.name: Ahadi Kahwizi Group

texts.fr: Le crédit précédent a aidé Biriduba à cultiver un champ de 54 ares, à supporter un coût d'exploitation de trois cents dollars et d'en produire sept cent soixante-huit dollars. Le gain réalisé a servi non seulement  à la survie familiale mais aussi dans l'élevage par l'achat de trois chèvres. Au cours de cette saison, la plupart de riziculteurs ont été buté par le bouchage du canal d'irrigation, heureusement qu'il a été réhabilité et un suivi permanent a été fait sur le champ pour veiller contre les oiseaux ravageurs.
texts.en:
Biriduba's previous loan helped him to cultivate 54 ares of land, to cover an operating cost of $300 and to earn $768 in the process. With the profit gained, he was able not only to provide for his family but also to acquire three goats.

This season, most rice farmers were hindered by the blockage of the irrigation canal which is fortunately back in operation.

The field is now constantly under watch to protect it from bird pests.

loans.use: to cover the costs of transplanting, weeding and guarding, and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Severio

texts.en: Sereverio comes from Nyakabingo. He is married and has four children. He is 35 years old. He deals in retail trading. He has a side income of boda boda (motorcycle taxi). He took a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to buy a new motorcycle, which will help him in transportation of goods for his shop. This will help him to reduce the expenses and time spent on transportation. He will eventually save more and, thereby, expand the business. He has a challenge of competition in the area (where the retail shops are many), but he hopes to outcompete them if he keeps getting the finacial boost and support from UGAFODE Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Wintarsih

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Wintarsih, who is a 33-year-old, married woman. Wintarsih and her husband have been merchants for 15 years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 4,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Wintarsih will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for her family.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.pt:
A cliente Argentina comerciante de 28 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 03 filhos, dos quais 02  frequentam o ensino primário e 01 ainda sem idade escolar,  vive  na casa própria, não  sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar Duvetes, Camas, roupas, bolsas para reforçar o seu negocio.
A cliente tem como sonho terminar muito cedo o reembolso do credito e pedir mais vezes o empréstimo para o crescimento do seu negócio.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar pretende tomar mais vezes para alcançar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Argentina is a 28-year-old client. She is married, and the mother of three children; two of them go to primary school, and the other one is not of school age yet. She owns the house where she lives, and is not responsible for anyone else.

With the requested amount, she will buy duvets, beds, clothes, and bags to strengthen her business.

Her dream is to pay off the loan soon, and apply for more loans in order to expand her business.

Her main challenges are financial in nature, but she has continued working. She is planning to apply for more loans to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy duvets, beds, clothes, and bags to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 35 years old, married, and blessed with five children.

She sells groceries, a business she has done for some years. It has been profitable.

She has borrowed a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase additional inventory of groceries for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to restock her grocery shop and repay her loan.

In the future she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of groceries for resale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
A cliente Beatriz, é Bombeira de 30 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 01 filho a frequentar o ensino primário, vive  na casa alugada, e não  sustenta a mais um ninguém .
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar cimento, areia, pedra , cimento cola  para dar a continuidade a obra da sua residência .
O cliente tem como sonho concluir a sua casa , o ensino superior, e casar oficialmente.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar, pretende tomar mais vezes para alcançar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
The name of this client is Beatriz. She is a firefighter. She is 30 years old, married, and has a son who goes to primary school. She lives in a rented house and is not responsible for anyone else.

With the requested amount, she will buy cement, sand, stones, and mortar to continue building her house.

Her dream is to finish building her house, finish her higher-education studies, and formalize her marriage.

Her main challenges are financial in nature, but she has continued to work. She plans to apply for more loans in order to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stones, and mortar to continue building her house.

loans.name: Nuray

texts.en:
Nuray is single, living with her parents.

In order to earn her pocket money and meet her needs, she is selling Tupperware products. She also started selling LR products this month. She says that people are interested in herbal products for their health and that is why she moved to that sector. She aims to make money out of it.

With the help of the loan, Nuray is planning to buy LR products in bulk. She is planning to complete her education and to stand on her feet.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nuray Hanım bekar ve ailesi ile yaşıyor. Kendi ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak, harçlığını kazanmak için Tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor. Bu ay LR ürünlerini satmaya da başlamış. Insanlar sağlık için bitkisel ürünlere yöneldiğinden bu sektöre girip daha çok kazanç elde etmeyi hedeflemiş. Aldığı kredi ile LR ürünleri alacak. Bıraktığı eğitimini tamamlamak ve kendi ayakları üzerinde durmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more LR products

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Con la visión de superación y grandes propósitos en la vida, es Jorge con 31 años de edad, es casado con una familia de una hija de un año, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del cantón el tablón.
Jorge para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la agricultura sembrando una variedad de verduras que sus tierras producen, con esta actividad el lleva 15 años de realizarlo. Jorge con el afán de contar con maíz para el resto del año, todos los años cultiva en sus tierras varias cuerdas de milpa, y ahora su mayor dificultad es comprar fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, porque lo precios son muy altos y no se encuentra dentro de  sus posibilidades adquirir los fertilizantes, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para cubrir esta necesidad.
Su gran esperanza es conseguir el crédito para que pueda brindarle a su milpa un buen mantenimiento y obtener al final del año la mejor cosecha de maíz. También su sueño es que su hija tenga la mejor educación.
texts.en:
Jorge has a vision of self-improvement and big plans for his life. He is 31 years old, married and has a one year old daughter. This humble family lives in a community of the quarter El Tablón.
To provide for his family, Jorge works in agriculture cultivating a variety of vegetables produced in his land. He's been doing this for the last 15 years. Jorge wants to have enough corn for the rest of the year, therefore, every year he grows several "cuerdas" (28 square meters) of cornfield. Currently, his biggest difficulty is to buy fertilizers to maintain his crops because the prices are too high and out of his possibilities. That is why he is requesting a loan.
He hopes to get the loan to be able to provide maintenance to his cornfield and obtain a better harvest at the end of the year. He also dreams of giving his daughter the best education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for corn crops

loans.name: Nimet

texts.en:
Nimet is married and a mother of four. She has been selling Tupperware for nine years. It all started when she bought a Tupperware product. She was very pleased with it. After talking with the sales representative, she decided to start selling it herself in order to fulfill her children's needs.

She says that she makes good sales and earns good money. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy bulk quantities of the products. She wants her children to complete their education to the highest level. She also wants to increase her business. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nimet Hanım evli, dört çocuk annesi. Dokuz buçuk yıldır Tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor. Bu işe bir ürün alarak başlıyor. Aldığı üründen memnun kalınca ve satış temsilcisi ile konuştuktan sonra kendisi de çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için bu işi yapmaya karar veriyor. Satışlarının ve kazancının çok iyi olduğunu söylüyor. Aldığı kredi ile ürün alacak. Çocuklarının en üst eğitimlerini alıp okullarını bitirmelerini istiyor. İşinde daha da yükselmek istiyor

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products to sell

loans.name: Dúo Abril Group

texts.es:
DUO ABRIL

Jessica tiene 28 años esta casada y  es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad. El negocio al cual se dedica es una librería y mini internet. Solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de más computadoras pues esta ampliando un nuevo negocio de café internet, Agradece la ayuda de fape y kiva pues es el tercer crédito y le ha sido de mucha utilidad. Espera con este crédito obtener un mejor servicio para sus clientes y así poder tener mas visitas y así obtener mejores ventas. Jessica se siente feliz pues esta logrando sus metas y así poder cumplir sus sueños, tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Jessica is 28 years old, married and the mother of two minor children. Her business is a book store and mini internet.

She requests a loan to buy more computers as she expands her business into an internet café. She appreciates the assistance of fape and kiva. It is the third loan and it has been very useful.

She expects to be able to provide a better service for her customers and it will lead to more visits and better sales. Jessica is happy to achieve her goals. She is able to fulfill her dreams and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy computers for internet cafe business.

loans.name: Resmiye

texts.en:
Resmiye is married and a mother of four. She does ornamental stitching and makes trousseaus. She started working from home and now she has a store of her own. She started her business with zero capital but now successfully continues.

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy bulk quantities of fabrics. She aims to fulfill her children's needs in a perfect way and to enable a good future for them.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Resmiye hanım evli dört çocuk annesi. Piko ve çeyiz işi malzemeler dikiyor. Evde başladığı işine dükkan açarak devam ediyor. Sıfır sermaye ile başladığı işine başarı ile devam ediyor. Aldığı kredi ile kumaş alacak. Çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını en iyi şekilde karşılamak ve onlara güzel bir gelecek sunmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.en:
Rosa Isela is a woman in her late 40's. She has been married to a loving husband and they have been blessed with children. Their children are old now, and they have gone their own ways.

Rosa's household is economically supported by her husband who works as a janitor for a local university. She contributes to the household income by running a small restaurant that she owns.

This restaurant is one of the biggest achievements of her life, because she started on a street stand next to a bus station, selling food. She lasted 21 years in it, but she did well, well enough to start a formal place of her own. She made this change seven months ago.

Although she is really happy living her dream, she did not estimate the expenses of having a formal restaurant, so she has been failing to meet with the client demand. In order to get her business together, she wants to take a 5,000 MXN (five thousand pesos) that will allow her to buy food to stock her restaurant.

loans.use: to stock up her restaurant.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, 32, is married and the responsible mother of two children. The family lives in the region of Lahore, Pakistan.

Shazia’s husband is a factory worker, but he also has cows that produce milk which Shazia sells in her neighborhood. Through breeding his cows, her husband has been increasing his herd over the years. Shazia, however, wants to buy an additional cow so she will have more milk to sell. Due to a lack of capital, though, she is unable to buy one.

So Shazia has now applied for a 80,000 PKR loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy another cow. She hopes that she will be able to see her dairy grow. She wants to give thanks to Kiva’s lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy another cow for the family's dairy so she will have more milk to sell.

loans.name: Renchinmyadag

texts.en:
Mrs. Renchinmyadag, 45 years old, lives with her husband in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has been teaching chemistry and biology at a high school since 1994. Her husband works at a gravel factory. Their children have all grown up and live on their own.

Using her previous loan, she has renovated her house and lives in a comfortable and warm place. Now, she is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to build a greenhouse on her land. By doing so, she can grow vegetables on her land during the cold period.

loans.use: to build greenhouse on her land

loans.name: Nahun Alexander

texts.es: Nahun de 32 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable en su hogar, desempeñando la labor de albañil independiente aproximadamente desde hace dos años con mucho esfuerzo logra cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Nahun vive al lado de su esposa quien le apoya económicamente para los gastos del hogar, en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida decide empezar con reparar su vivienda. Pero para hacer esto Nahun no cuenta con los fondos necesarios y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorado por el pasar de los años, y de esta manera poder estar más tranquilos y seguros en esta época de lluvia.
texts.en:
Nahun, 32, is a hardworking and very responsible man in his home. For about two years, he's worked as an independent mason. With a lot of effort, he's able to cover his household's basic expenses.

Nahun lives with his wife, whom he supports economically with household expenses. In search of a better quality of life, he began repairing his home. But Nahun doesn't have the necessary funds to do this and is thus seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy sheet metal, nails, iron and payment for labor to change the roof on his house. It's currently deteriorated due to the passage of the years. In this way, he will be able to be more relaxed and secure in this rainy season.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, nails, iron and labor payment to change the food on his house.

loans.name: Almin Yanira

texts.es: Almin de 46 años de edad ella vive con su esposo su vivienda es propia, es una mujer muy trabajadora y honrada que siempre se ha esforzado por generar ingresos para su hogar y que no les falte nada, por años ha ayudado a su esposo con el sustento del hogar. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de artículos de primera necesidad; en su municipio las tiendas están a grandes distancias y por eso su pequeño negocio tiene mucha rentabilidad aunque le hacen falta muchos productos que sus clientes necesitan es por eso que ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en huevos, golosinas, aceite, azúcar, café, sopas, verduras, refrescos, pan dulce, sal, condimentos, etc. Para surtir su negocio de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su esposo y mejorar las ganancias del negocio ella espera una respuesta favorable a su crédito para invertir en el negocio lo más pronto posible.
texts.en: Almin, 46 years old, lives with her husband in their own home. She is a very hardworking and honest woman who has always worked to make income for her home so they do not lack anything. For years she has helped her husband support the home. She has a small business of basic products. In her municipality the stores are great distances and that is why her small business has a lot of profitability, although she lacks many products that her customers need. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in eggs, sugar, candy, oil, sugar, coffee, soup, vegetables, beverages, sweet bread, salt, condiments, etc. to supply her business and in this way improve her and her husband's living conditions and improve the earnings of the business. She hopes for a favorable response to her loan in order to invest in the business as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in: eggs, candy, oil, sugar, coffee, soup, vegetables, beverages, sweet bread, salt, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Enny

texts.es:
Enny continúa con su negocio de venta de comida. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de insumos de cocina, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque sus ventas fueron buenas. Actualmente se especializa en la preparación de ‘patasca’ que es una comida a base de cabeza de cerdo y maiz, se sirve como sopa y es muy popular por la creencia popular de que elimina la resaca, “este plato es una comida tradicional para curar la resaca del amanecer del Año Nuevo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y continuas, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de ollas y cubiertos. Su sueño es tener un restaurante, ella desea comprar ollas y cubiertos para cocinar patasca. Este préstamo es la 2 secuencia con la institución. 
Es por esos motivos que Enny solicita un préstamo para la compra de ollas y cubiertos para cocinar patasca.
texts.en:
Enny continues selling food. WIth the loan she received, she bought cooking ingredients. She paid the loan according to plan because her sales were good.

She is currently specializes in preparing "patasca," which is a dish made of pig's head, and corn. It is served as soup, and it is very popular because people think it cures hangover.

"This dish is a traditional food that cures hangover on New Year's Day..." she says. The advantage with her business is that she sells continuously, every day. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy pots and cutlery.

Her dream is to buy a restaurant. She wants to buy pots and cutlery to cook "patasca". This is her second loan with the institution.

This is why Enny is requesting a loan to buy pots and cutlery to cook "patasca."

loans.use: to buy pots and cutlery to cook "patasca".

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es: Oscar de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el posee tres molinos nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz,  adicional a eso también se dedica al transporte de personal, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, el solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y darles mantenimiento y así seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 33 years old and lives at his own house along with his wife and son.

He has owned three nixtamal (corn) mills at his house for 10 years. He has many clients, especially women who make tortillas and need to grind the corn. Additionally, he also works as personnel carrier. He manages to pay for some of the household expenses with what he earns working.

He is requesting a loan to buy what is necessary for the mill such as belts, discs, blades, etc. and to maintain them and thus be able to keep working in order to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy belts, discs, blades, etc. and maintain them.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
The key to a more appealing “sari-sari” or variety store is its large inventory. Riza’s store has limited stocks as you can see in the picture. This is why she wants to avail of PhP 8,000 loan to buy supplies like grocery items and dry goods. These additional stocks will enhance the competitiveness of her store within their community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. 

Riza’s husband, Freddie, helps in strengthening their business by selling snacks within the vicinity of a local high school. There he sells spaghetti, sandwiches, and cold beverages. These are favorite snacks of many students. 

If the couple’s business will grow in progress according to their plan, its income can sufficiently meet their basic needs and their children’s educational expenses. They want all their children to finish college and have a brighter future.
 
Riza meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies like grocery items and dry goods

loans.name: Yoweri

texts.en: Yoweri comes from Kyeganywa and he is 28 years old. He has 5 children. He owns a retail shop and a side income from a milling machine. He has applied for a loan of ugx1,500,0000 to assist him buy another milling machine to diversify his income. The problem is that where he gets fuel for his machine is too far. So some times he loses customers when the fuel is used up.

loans.use: To buy a milling machine

loans.name: Jose Patrocinio

texts.es: Jose es un hombre trabajador, él cuenta que está muy contento con su préstamo al que tuvo la oportunidad de acceder, pues a Dios gracias con  ello logro comprar su toro y al momento de venderlo pudo obtener una buena ganancia. Jose ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción de su casa, pues no cuenta con el efectivo necesario para ello, y es muy importante  darle a su familia un mejor hogar. Su esperanza de vida es comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Jose is a hard-working man,he says that he is very content with the loan that he had the opportunity to obtain. With thanks to God, with it he was able to buy his bull, and immediately upon selling it, he was able to get a good profit.

Jose now seeks a new loan for the purchase of construction materials for his house, as he does not have the money he needs for it, and it is very important for him to give his family a better home. His hope in life is to buy land.

loans.use: to buy materials for the construction of his house.

loans.name: Biritazal

texts.en: Biritazal is 36 years old, married, and has five children. He comes from Nyabihoko. To earn a living, he fattens cattle. He requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more cattle for fattening. The problem he faces is the prolonged drought in the area; grass and water have dried up. The animals have to travel long distances for water.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is from Gyumri town. He  works as a baker in one of the bakeries in Gyumri town. In his house Sergey has a smokehouse, where he makes smoked fish for selling to his customers.

Sergey works with his mother and two brothers, who are his main support and help. Sergey asks for this loan to purchase fishes (150) and chickens (125), in order to make smoked meat to sell.

Sergey  has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This loan will really help Sergey to improve his business, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fishes (150) and chickens (125)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $650 helps this borrower to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a man on his middle 40's. He is single and has no children. He lives at his mother's place in order to take care of her; otherwise she would be living on her own. He supports the house and has been taking care of his mother for the last years.

According to people that Kubo interviewed, Miguel is a very reliable person, and he is responsible, honest, and works hard every day.

Miguel makes a living working as a bricklayer. He works on different constructions to create an income as high as possible, but he thinks that routine is pretty simple so not long ago he decided he wanted to study something that could feed his soul. He didn't mind his age, and he started studying theology. He found in theology a new perspective of life. In his loan request he stated, and we quote, "You can't ever be old enough to learn."

Miguel quit his studies because he couldn't afford his study expenses and his mother's house at the same time, so he thought his mother and the house were the biggest priority.

Today he has got a little more economical solvency so he decided it was time to go back to his theology lessons, but to continue he needs to buy books, and some of those are expensive. In order to buy the books, he is looking for a 5,253 MXN loan.

Kubo understood through his references, that he has a huge moral quality. That is why Kubo is confident that he will pay back the loan without trouble.

loans.use: Buy books to keep studying

loans.name: Velia

texts.en:
Velia is a woman on her middle 40's, has been married for a long time, and has two children, who economically rely on her and her husband. Velia's family resides on a house that they own.

Velia and her husband make a living by selling cloth supplies; more specifically, they sell supplies for dresses that women buy for weddings, 15-year-old parties, and special situations. She sells these products in two different stands that she has got at a market. She and her husband are in charge of the management of the stores.

At Kubo likes very much these clients because if they succeed with their loan, it means they will be creating jobs with their business. At this very moment, they have a few employees, but if they achieve their long term goals, they will be able to hire more staff.

Velia is asking for a 19,000 MXN (nineteen thousand pesos) loan to buy showcases to display her merchandise in the stores. She hopes to attract more clients, and she thinks that she will if people are able to see the products from the outside of the store.

loans.use: to buy showcases

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: Gustavo de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el es un hombre muy trabajor desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como puede salir adelante, el cliente esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de mas cerdos y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 42 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He is very hardworking. He has been breeding and selling pigs for 5 years. Income from this work enables him to get ahead.

He requests a loan to buy more pigs. This will allow him to continue with his work and generate good income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Mujeres Trabajadoras” está en su primer ciclo, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mónica, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de empanadas que hace se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta y de esa forma puede dar a su familia una vida sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus empanadas, como ser: carne, condimentos, hortalizas, masas para empanadas, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Trabajadoras" is in its first cycle, and they have all pledged to work and help each other to succeed.

They are doing the poverty elimination survey which helps them strive to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Monica, who through hard work and continuous effort, makes a dignified and honest living selling empanadas. This way she can give her family a life free of the hardship she experienced.

She is applying for a loan in order to invest in buying supplies to make her empanadas, such as meat, seasoning, vegetables, dough for empanadas and other things. This will allow her to continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasoning, vegetables, dough for empanadas and other things which will allow her to continue her sales.

loans.name: Songas Tazara Group

texts.en:
MARY is in her late 20s and is married with two children.  One of them is in school and the other one is still small.  She has been running a mamalishe business for four years now.  She works from 05am to 05pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be MARY's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store.  She dreams owning  a Hotel.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group SONGAS TAZARA,  which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying 20 sacks of rice to improve her stock

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en:
Misheck, 74, is a farmer in Kabwe, Zambia. In order to expand his vegetable production he is requesting a water pump from Rent to Own.

Misheck has been growing onions, cabbage and tomatoes on his farm to supply local markets in Kabwe. He already has a small water pump and wants to buy another pump to grow his production

Rent to Own will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides Misheck with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

With a water pump Misheck will be able to increase the volume of crops he is growing, He is already planning on growing a larger portion of onion and cabbage that he can sell at the local market.

loans.use: To pay for an irrigation pump

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a man in his early 50's. He has been married to a loving wife for a long time. Unluckily for Francisco and his wife, they were never able to have children. They only have each other in this world.

They make a living by raising and selling their raised animals. They raise pigs and lambs, and make extra income by selling natural products.


Francisco's biggest achievements are creating a good and legitimate business, buying a truck to transport his animals and building his house. Francisco has had past loans, but he has always struggled to pay taxes out of those. He needs 10,527.00 MXN to buy young lambs and piggies, and then to raise them in order to meet the future demand.

Francisco is pictured surrounded by his lambs. After interviewing the client Kubo concluded that Francisco and his wife are both people to be trusted, because of their dedication and their will to succeed.

loans.use: To buy lambs and pigs

loans.name: Esnarty

texts.en:
Esnarty is a farmer in Kabwe, Zambia. In order to expand her vegetable production she is requesting a water pump from Rent to Own.

Esnarty has been growing onions, cabbages and fresh maize on her farm to supply local markets in Kabwe. She already has a waterpump and wants to buy another pump to grow her production.

Rent to Own will deliver a water pump directly to her farm. Rent to Own also provides Esnarty with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until she has paid off the loan.

With a water pump Esnarty will be able to increase the volume of crops she is growing. She is already planning on growing a larger portion of fresh maize and cabbage that she can sell at the local market.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables in larger quantities: tomatoes, chilis, water spinach, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Riziki Mpya Group

texts.fr: Omari est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Riziki Mpya», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 33 ans,  divorcée, mère de sept enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 45 paires de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu après avoir donné sa maison en location. Elle souhaite, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Omari is a vendor, a member of the Riziki Mpya banc villageoise and a client of IMF Hekima. She is 33 years, divorced, and has seven children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling used shoes at a local market for two years. She will buy 45 pairs of shoes for resale. She launched her business with the funds she earned after renting out her house. Her goal is to support and educate her children. In conclusion, Omari thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 45 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Grau - Pilcomayo Group

texts.es: Doris es una socia de la alcancía comunal “Grau - Pilcomayo”, el préstamo obtenido lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes al por mayor para así implementar su negocio, con eso ha podido aumentar su capital en su negocio, sus metas ahora es ampliar su tiendita a llegar a ser un minimarket, además darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Doris está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo económico que se le ha dado, al igual que a las demás integrantes de la alcancía comunal "Grau - Pilcomayo". Doris es la que esta al medio del grupo con un chaleco negro y chompa rosada y tiene anteojos.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the "Grau - Pilcomayo” communal bank. After obtaining the loan, she invested it in the purchase of grocery mechandise at wholesale, in order to run her business. This way she has been able to increase her business's working capital. Now her goal is to expand her store to become a minimarket, and also to give her children a better education and improve her family's quality of life.

Doris is very grateful for all the financial support she has been given, in the same way as the other members of the "Grau - Pilcomayo” communal bank.

Doris is the one in the middle of the group, with a black vest, pink sweater and glasses.

loans.use: To buy general grocery merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one more piglet and also to buy a school uniform, stationery, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a farmer in Petauke, Zambia. In order to expand his vegetable production, he is requesting a water pump from Rent to Own.

Paul has been growing tomatoes, cabbages and fresh greens on his farm to supply local markets in Petauke. Using buckets, he has been drawing water from a nearby stream to irrigate his crops. This is an extremely labour intensive task, especially now that the dry season has begun.

Rent to Own will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides Paul with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

With a water pump Paul will be able to reduce the time he spends watering his crops, and will no longer have to draw water by hand.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is a 62 year-old single woman, from the village of Zeda Sakara. The only source of income for her is from a small agribusiness. She cultivates a plot of agricultural land and also harvests nuts seasonally. In order to increase her income and more effectively meet the daily costs, Nani wants  to expand her business and start dairy farming. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial and poor living conditions.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Nani applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.
Nani plans to purchase a cow, start producing milk-products, which will be sold locally at a good price. 
This credit will be a great support for her. Nani is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to generate more income and become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start dairy farming

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto lives in Canlambo, Larena and supports his three daughters by building houses from the ground up.

He has successfully repaid his previous loan and requested another loan, which he used to buy building materials, paints, and to pay his workers.

He wants his daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work he has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paints & pay his workers.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia is juggling the management of her business and the supervision of the renovation of her home. Eulalia hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Eulalia has given priority to her role as a micro-finance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
For the past six months, Lorie considered growing her internet café business, with the help of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), her previous loan amount of PHP 15,000 was approved by them. She was able to maintain every computer unit of the business because of the loan. Sincerest gratitude she wants to send to everyone who’ve been part of the business success, CCT and all of the lenders.

Lorie prays that God will continually provide safe and good health for her family. According to Lorie, she’ll save more customers if she can add another unit of computer to her internet café business. That’s why she applied for a loan of PHP 20,000. This amount will be used to buy a computer set. In the event that she has drastic earnings, that’s the time she will add another business to gain more earnings each day. All of her hard work is for her family. With the help of the Lord, she believes that He will provide daily customers for the business.

Lorie believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer set to be used in her internet café.

loans.name: Nuriat

texts.en:
Nuriat used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She is a hardworking married woman with six children, and the responsibility of looking after the children solely rests on her.

She is a farmer who grows maize and tomatoes but also has cows, where she gets milk to sell to supplement her income. She is determined to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification, and she also aims to finish construction of her house, despite challenges of being limited by inadequate capital and weather changes that reduce her profit margin.

Nuriat is seeking a loan to buy roofing materials for the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en:
Aghavni has successfully paid her two Kiva loans. She used them in developing her farm, which is currently sustainable and profitable. Aghavni asks for this loan to be able to purchase two sows and forage for feeding the livestock. She still lives in Azatan village of the Shirak region with her husband. Her son got married and they already have a little son named Erik.

Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Aghavni's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

Aghavni hopes to receive another loan and continue to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase two sows and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 25 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her parents and her four siblings in a rented house in Mzuzu, Malawi. She is requesting her first Kiva loan in order to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. This means Edith will provide financial services to people in her community of Mzuzu and earn a profit.

Edith is hopeful that once she starts running her own Zoona business, she will be able to provide for her family and take her daughter to school. She explains that it has not been easy to provide basic needs for her three-year-old daughter and contribute financially at home. By starting her own business, Edith will be able to provide for her daughter and help support her family.

Edith will set up her business in Mzuzu. Zoona has done market research in the area and established that the location is ideal for her to set up her mobile money transfer trolley. With this loan, Edith will be able to pay for her trading trolley, a web-enabled mobile phone and have the funds needed to serve people in Mzuzu who need to send and receive money.

Edith's biggest dream is to see her daughter through college; she says this is important to her because she would like her daughter to have opportunities that she never had.

Edith thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent

loans.name: Gedeon

texts.en:
Gedeon is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in a small town near Congo with his four siblings and parents, who are both nurses. Due to his strong academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because he wants to learn the skills necessary to become a successful entrepreneur. Specifically, he wants to improve his critical thinking and technology skills.

Gedeon plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university.

He doesn't have precise plans for his life after graduating, but he hopes to hone his business skills by starting many projects of his own.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stock of mobile phone credit and electricity credit.

loans.name: Hendrique

texts.en: Hendrique is a 38-year-old married father of five children who works hard to support his family. He is a fireman. Even though the family works very hard, it can be difficult for him to afford the cost of his son's education. This loan of $800 will allow Hendrique to help ensure his son will graduate from University. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. Hendrique loves his son very much, and, in the future, Hendrique hopes that his son will be able to work (in the government, in agriculture, in a business).

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush is from Vahramaberd village in the Shirak region along with his parents and his brother. Artush has been involved in agribusiness since his childhood and is already skilled and professional in that field. Artush currently keeps calves, cows, 20 sheep, a pig, three piglets, and hens. He also cultivates wheat and potato. Artush's parents are the main support for him in farming activities. Aiming to boost income from agriculture and develop their agribusiness, Artush has applied for this loan. He plans to purchase three oxen, one ton of potato seeds for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock.

Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Artush's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen, one ton of potato seeds for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Mangsongsim - Nlalaa Group

texts.en:
Fuseina is 45 years, married, and has 5 children, all of whom are attending school. Fuseina lives in Karaga in the northern region of Ghana. She is an active woman in a retail business. She is the individual pictured sitting with the hand raised in the photo.

Fuseina retails clothes and has been in that business for the past 15 years. She has four employees working with her.

Fuseina is a member of a group called ‘Mangsongsim – Nlaala’ in Karaga. Fuseina’s retail business is challenged with inadequate capital.

She and her group have requested a loan amount of GHC 11,800,00. Fuseina’s share of the loan is GH 60,000, which she would use to buy additional assorted items of stock for retail. She has a good customer base and hopes to get added capital to expand her business.

She wish to pay-off the loan with the income she would get from the trade if she gets funded.

Fuseina is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional assorted items of stock (clothing) for retail.

loans.name: Luz Del Rosario Group

texts.en:
Rosario is a rural area with a temperate climate outside of Chiantla, Guatemala. In this indigenous community, where the spoken language is Mam, live the 11 clients of trust bank ¨Luz del Rosario¨, or ¨Light of Rosario¨. Between 19 and 53 years of age, these women are all mothers as well as business-owners, caring for 1-6 children each. While most of the women did not have the opportunity to go to school, and the few who did only studied through second grade, all of them are able to provide their children with this opportunity, and thanks to the success these women have in their businesses, their children are studying far beyond just primary school.

Olga, the president of Luz del Rosario, is 33 years old and married to her husband of 15 years, who works in agriculture. The couples has 5 children ranging from 1 to 14 years old who are in school. Olga was not able to go to school, and now runs multiple businesses: shoe sales and a tailoring business to create some extra income for her family.

With her new loan, Olga will buy more shoes to sell and fabric to fashion her beautiful clothing products.

Olga and her members of the trust bank Luz del Rosario are thankful to Kiva investors for the funds that will help their business to succeed.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell and fabric to fashion her beautiful clothing products.

loans.name: El Quetzal Group

texts.en:
Momostenango is a small city located above the department of Totonicapán, in the plains of western Guatemala. In the mountainous, rural area surrounding Momostenango live the eight women of trust bank “El Quetzal,” their group name representing the national bird of Guatemala as well as the country´s currency.

Most of these women, who are between 21 and 55 years of age, did not have access to education when they were young.

Rosa, the president of the group, is 26 years old and has never received formal education. With two children, ages six and three, and her own convenience store, this young woman is very busy. With the loan she is requesting, Rosa will invest in products for her store, including sugar, beans and soap. In addition, she would like to buy a display cabinet in which to showcase and store her goods. On her third cycle with Friendship Bridge, and her first time requesting a loan from Kiva, Rosa has greatly appreciated the fast and frequent credits she receives, and has enjoyed her role as group president, which has been an opportunity for her to grow in confidence as a leader.

loans.use: to buy products for her store, including sugar, beans and soap. In addition, she would like to buy a display cabinet in which to showcase and store her goods.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith es una joven que ofrece sus servicios mediante un salón de belleza ubicado en su propia vivienda y además atiende algunos clientes a domicilio. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de productos necesarios para el desarrollo de esta actividad. Con esto podrá incrementar los ingresos de los cuales dependen ella y su hija.
texts.en: Judith is a young woman that provides beauty salon services in her home, and she also serves some clients in their homes.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 colones to purchase the supplies she needs to operate her business.  With this loan, she will be able to increase her income, on which she and her daughter depend.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
A 1,000 USD loan is offered to Ana to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of 100 USD. She will use the loan to buy inventory to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, Coca-Cola, Sprite, beer, biscuits, eggs, and shampoo. She is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in this business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, Coca-Cola, Sprite, beer, biscuits, eggs and shampoo.

loans.name: Betinha

texts.en:
Betinha is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 38 years old and runs a kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, eggs, slippers, shampoo, shop and biscuits. She makes good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Betinha lives in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, eggs, slippers, shampoo, shop and biscuits.

loans.name: Kpanmanga - Nakpayili Group

texts.en:
Safura is a 46-year-old hardworking woman from Nakpayili in the northern region of Ghana. Safura is married and has five children. Safura is the individual pictured standing fourth from left with both hands waving in the photo.

Safura is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for more than a decade. The name of the group is ‘Kpanmanga-Nakpayili’, which means hard work. Safura earns a good profit from the business as the group is known for the quality of butter it always processes. The group had been trained to improve their shea butter processing techniques such that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets around Bimbilla and beyond.

Safura and ‘Kpanmanga- Nakpayili’ group, after paying off a previous loan of GHC 8,000, has asked for a new loan of GHC 9,100. Safura’s share of the current loan is GHC 800, which will help her to buy shea nuts for processing into shea butter. Safura hopes to earn more income to pay back this loan and support her family with food.

Safura remains thankful to Kiva lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing into shea butter.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia and she is very determined to succeed in her business industry.

Within her 10 years of residency in Batasan, Quezon City, she really has pursued hard to equip and improve her business. Kiva was a big help in this process. As a matter of fact, the loan she got here recently was used for her trade.

As you can see above, she is currently managing a market stand business. But aside from this, she also supervises a house-rental business where she gets additional income. However, Delia is thinking of further expanding this. She hopes that you can help her in this regard.

Relative to this, she is requesting to acquire a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 that she would use to purchase more fruits, vegetables, and meat products to sell. The remaining amount, if any, would be used to beautify her store.

You can now be a big part in Delia’s walk to success.

She continues to strive hard in this business because she wants to earn her children a living and a future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beef, chicken, pork and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en: Bhawani is 44 years old, married and has two children, ages 23 and 22. Many years ago, she established her milk sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young cow. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy young cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an electronic mobile load and sim card retailing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional amount of electronic mobile load and more sim cards to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for seven years. Elizabeth earns more income from selling ready to wear.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load and more sim cards to sell.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and three children in Kareli district. Each family member get social assistance from the government as they are refugees. Tamar decided to start her business and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. With the received credit, Tamara will start producing Tklapi (different kinds of fruit pastilles dried in the sun). Tamar will sell the produced Tklapi at a good price to generate income. She hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to start producing Tklapi (different kinds of fruits pastilles dried in the sun).

loans.name: Adriana Marcela

texts.es: Adriana es una emprendedora mujer residenciada en Cartagena de Indias que encontró su oportunidad de negocio, cuando se trasladó a una urbanización de esta ciudad y con el apoyo de su madre, empezó a funcionar en su nueva vivienda un restaurante en el que ofrecen desayunos, almuerzos típicos y por las noches comidas rápidas.  Ella es madre soltera de una niña de tres años de edad a quien ofrece bienestar con las utilidades que recibe de su trabajo, y para ella esto es su principal motivación por eso todos los días de la semana atendiendo su negocio y recibiendo en la terraza de su vivienda a los comensales.  . En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en surtido de víveres y en enseres; silla, mesas y una carpa. Con esta inversión mejorará la imagen de su negocio y con ello la afluencia de clientes. Su sueño de prosperidad es convertirse en un restaurante reconocido de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Adriana is a female entrepreneur who resides in Cartagena de Indias and has encountered an opportunity to start a business. When she moved to an urban area in this city, with her mother's help, she launched a new restaurant in her home, offering breakfasts, typical lunches, and, at night, fast meals.

Adriana is the single mother of a three-year-old girl to whom she offers well-being with the earnings she receives from her work. This is Adriana's principal motivation. For this reason, every day of the week she attends to her business and receives her table companions on the patio of her house.

At present, Adriana is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in a selection of groceries and in furnishings (chairs and tables) and in a canvas tent. This investment will improve the image of her business and, with that, the affluence of her customers.

Adriana dreams of prosperity, converting her restaurant into a recognized place in the city.

loans.use: invest in a selection of grocery supplies and furnishings, including chairs and tables, and in a canvas tent.

loans.name: Jenniffer  De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Jenniffer es una joven deseosa por un futuro mejor, lleno de oportunidades y con muchos deseos de superación. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y está en quinto año de la licenciatura en Contabilidad y Finanzas, carrera que desde su adolescencia le pareció la mejor para ella. A pesar que ella no vive con su mamá, puesto que trabaja en Costa Rica, cuenta con su apoyo, al igual al de su padre que es docente y que está en todo momento que la necesita.
En estos momentos, que Jenniffer ya está finalizando su carrera, desea seguir incrementando sus conocimientos cognitivos sobre la contabilidad, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar un posgrado y así seguir creciendo profesionalmente. Esto le permitirá tener mejores oportunidades de empleo. Su próxima meta es estudiar inglés, pues desea aprender otro idioma.
texts.en:
Jenniffer is a young woman eager for a better future full of opportunities and with dreams of self improvement. She is 25 years old and is in the fifth year of Accounting and Finance degree. Since adolescence she believed this to be the best degree for herself.

Although she does not live with her mother, as she works in Costa Rica, she counts on her support, as well as that of her father who is a teacher and helps whenever she needs him.

Now that Jenniffer is finishing her degree, she wants to continue increasing her knowledge of accounting, which is why she is asking for a loan to pay for graduate studies and in that way continue growing professionally. This will allow her more employment opportunities. Her next goal is to study English, as she wants to learn another language.

loans.use: to pay for her graduate studies.

loans.name: Clementino

texts.en:
A loan of $1000.00 is provided to Clementino to improve his business. Clementino lives in Maubesse. Most of his daily income is from selling shoes so he is still happy to do his business. 

He started his business in 2008 with his own working capital of $750.00. He will use this money to buy more shoes, socks, slippers and other things to sell, according to people's likes, because it has become his business. He is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin that allows him to have more working capital to buy more shoes and be able to manage his business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, socks, slippers and other things to sell

loans.name: Los Mangales Group

texts.es:
Mariloida es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 4, 6, 10 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrescos y pan.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘cotoca’ área rural que se ocupa del acopio de la producción agrícola para ser distribuida en los mercados de la ciudad.
Mariloida es trigueña de baja estatura y físico robusto (sentada al centro, viste pantalón corto rojo), su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja la tierra y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa construida de madera que sólo cuenta con energía eléctrica. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio para ayudar a su familia la llevó a forma una banca de personas con negocios como; taller de cerrajería, comercio de semillas, venta de comida, artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros de sao, servicio de limpieza y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos y pan; ella vende en una esquina de la calle, donde desde muy temprano por la mañana vende pan y refrescos, el clima cálido del lugar ayuda en la venta de refrescos, “me traen pan fresco por la mañana y por la tarde…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un puesto en el mercado donde poder vender pan. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, Ella desea comprar un puesto de venta fijo dentro del mercado local para poder trabajar bajo techo y en mejores condiciones. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mariloida solicita un préstamo para la compra de un puesto de venta en el mercado para poder vender pan.
texts.en:
Mariloida is a 40-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has four children, aged 4, 6, 10 and 15. Her business is selling soft drinks and bread.

She is a good mother, independent and very dependable. She carries out her business in Cotoca, a rural zone which serves as a collection point for agricultural products which are then distributed to the markets in the city.

Mariloida is of mixed ethnic heritage, short in stature and with a robust build. (She is seated at center in the photo, wearing red shorts.) Her native language is Guaraní, and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works the land, and with her children who are in school. They live in a house built of wood which has only electrical services. The need to improve her business in order to help her family led her to form a communal bank with people who have businesses such as a locksmith's workshop, seed sales, food sales, leather handicrafts, woven hat production, cleaning services and a neighborhood store.

Her business is selling soft drinks and bread. She sells them on a street corner, starting very early in the morning. The warm climate of the area helps with the sale of cold drinks. "They deliver fresh bread to me in the morning and in the afternoon," she comments. The advantage of her business is that her sales take place every day. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a stand in the market where she can sell bread. Her dream is to have a permanent sales stand. She would like to buy a fixed sales stand in the local market so that she can work under a roof and under better conditions. This is her first loan sequence with the institution during the five years she has been operating this business.

For these reasons, Mariloida is requesting a loan to buy a sales stand in the market where she can sell bread.

loans.use: to buy a sales stand in the market in order to sell bread.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, vive únicamente con sus hijos, el oficio lo aprendió de un amigo, lleva 20 años desarrollando dicha actividad, su horario es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, por su experiencia no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar pintura, hierro, láminas, etc., para fabricar puertas, portones, ventanas ente otras pizas de metal, cree que así tendrá los materiales necesarios para atender a sus clientes en menor tiempo y generar nuevos ingresos. Su dificultad es que las ventas bajen o que no pueda ejecutar proyectos.
Las aspiraciones son mantener su negocio, generar los ingresos necesarios para cancelar sus deudas y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlo has a metal working workshop. He lives solely with his children.

Carlo learned his trade from a friend. He has now been in the busienss for twenty years. He works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. Because of all his experience, he really doesn't have any difficulties with his busienss.

Carlo needs a loan to purchase paint, iron, sheet metal etc. for making doors, gates, windows and other metal works. He believes that his investment he will get him the materials he needs to tend to his customers more quickly and generate new income. A challenge that Carlo faces is that sales go down and he can't render his projects.
