Carlo's hopes are to maintain his business and generate the income he needs to pay off his debts and meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase paint, iron, sheet metal etc. for making doors, gates, windows and other metal works.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa es una joven muy esforzada que vende diversos productos en su tienda de abarrotes. Solicita un préstamo de mil quinientos dólares ($1,500), para la compra de mercadería que le permita ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Santa is a hardworking young woman who sells different kinds of products in her general store. She is applying for a loan of $1,500 to buy the goods that allow her to offer a wide variety of products to her customers and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her general store.

loans.name: Fredys Manuel

texts.en:
Fredys is 58 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. He has two children, a boy who is 21 and a girl who is 16 years of age. For many years, he’s been working in his own business, which he started 24 years ago, a store that has allowed him to provide for his family and accomplish great things.

The weather has brought some issues for his customer who visit the store where they don’t only buy stuff but spend time with his friends and even play billiards. In order to make his business sustainable and diversify the offer, he’s asking for a loan so he can buy inputs like snacks, a cooler and also buy some pigs, food and vaccines for them to start a new business.

Fredys is determined to have two functional and successful businesses and one day, be able to leave them both to his children. You can be part of this story by loaning and helping this man accomplish all that he wants.

loans.use: to buy inputs like snacks and a cooler and also buy some pigs, food and vaccines for them to start a new business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 62 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta sexto grado, porque sus padres no pudieron seguirle ayudando con el estudio, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian y uno trabaja, su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas.

Victoria, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 16 años, desde muy joven su madre le enseño a hacer tortillas para que le apoyara con los quehaceres del hogar, luego que se caso y tuvo su familia decidió colocar su propio negocio; la venta la realiza en su casa y durante la jornada de venta una de sus hijas le ayuda con el negocio y la venta la realiza al medio día y por las tardes. 

Victoria, necesita el préstamo para comprar más maíz y leña para su negocio, con ello espera mejorar los ingresos y con ello poder brindarle a su familia una mejor condición económica y continuar ayudando a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando.

Victoria, sueña con tener una plancha de gas propano y también quiere poder ampliar más su casa.
texts.en: 62-year-old Victoria was only educated to year six, because her parents were not able to continue helping her with her studies. She is married with 3 children, two of whom are studying and the other one works. Her husband works as an agricultural labourer. Victoria has sold tortillas for 16 years. When she was a young girl, her mother taught her how to make tortillas so she could help her with the housework. later, when she had got married and had her family, she decided to set up her own business. She sells her tortillas from her home at lunchtime and in the evening and, during the working day, one of her daughters helps her in the business. Victoria needs the loan to buy more corn and wood for her business, so she can boost her income and, as a result, improve her family's finances and keep helping her children so they can continue their education. Veronica's dream is to have a propane gas griddle and she would also like to extend her home.

loans.use: para comprar más maíz y leña para su negocio.

loans.name: Sonia Marlene

texts.es:
Sonia, de 42 años de edad, no estudio, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 13, 10 y 6 años de edad, todos asisten a la escuela.

Sonia, comercializa camarones desde hace 6 años, aprendió el negocio porque ella le ayudaba a una señora a vender  camarones en el mercado, luego decidió colocar su propio negocio; pero además de eso también vende semilla de marañón, ella viaja desde su casa hasta su puesto de venta en bus y se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. de la mañana para preparar el camarón y poder salir a las 5:30 de la mañana para el mercado y regresar a casa a las 4:00 de la tarde todos los días.

Sonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar más camarones para el negocio y para comprar semilla de marañón para vender.

El sueño de Sonia, es poder algún día construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old and did not go to school. She is a single mother with three children who are 13, 10, and 6 years old, all of whom attend school.

Sonia has been selling shrimp for six years. She learned this business because she used to help out another woman with selling shrimp at the market. She later decided to start her own business. In addition to shrimp, she sells cashew seeds. She takes the bus from her house to her business, and gets up at 4:00am in order to prepare the shrimp and leave at 5:30am for the market, returning home at 4:00pm every day.

Sonia needs the loan to purchase more shrimp for her business and to purchase cashew seeds to sell. Her dream is to one day build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more shrimp for her business and to purchase cashew seeds to sell.

loans.name: Adan

texts.en:
Adan is 55 years old and lives in the municipality of Yolombó. He has four children, two men and two women; they are all grown up now and he feels really proud of all of them. Twenty years ago he started a business raising pigs and chickens, which allowed him to provide for his family.

His family is going through some rough economic times, for which reason he wants to improve his business so the sales increase. In this way, he can help and support his family. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy some pigs, some chickens and food for all of them.

Adan has many dreams, but he lives for his family, so one of his biggest dreams is to give all of them a good quality of life. He also would like to improve his house. You can help Adan to accomplish all of his dreams; a loan will do a lot for him.

loans.use: to buy some pigs, some chickens, and food for all of them

loans.name: Gabriel Santana

texts.es: Gabriel es un joven tendero de 27 años residenciado en un barrio del municipio de Cartagena, que decidió emprender su propio negocio al considerar que toda la experiencia que había recopilado en empleos anteriores, en negocios de este mismo formato, le permitirían tener éxito en su proyecto de negocio, fue así como en el año 2012, sus vecinos encontraron en las cercanías del sector un negocio que les proveería de frutas y verduras frescas, legumbres, carnes y todo tipo de víveres necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas y un variado surtido de productos para el aseo personal y del hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en surtido de víveres y productos de aseo para el hogar con la finalidad de que sus clientes encuentren todo en un mismo lugar.  Gabriel es soltero y desea seguir creciendo en sus negocios para estar preparado para conformar un hogar y tener hijos.
texts.en: Gabriel, a young 27 year old shopkeeper, lives in a neighborhood in Cartagena.  He decided to establish his own business after thinking about all the experience he had gained in previous jobs, in similar businesses, which would allow him to be successful in his business venture.  That was how, in 2012, his neighbors found a business in the surrounding area that would provide fresh fruits and vegetables, legumes, meat, and other types of groceries needed to prepare meals, as well as all personal hygiene and household products.  Currently, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and will invest in an assortment of groceries, toiletries, and household products so that his customers find everything in the same place.  Gabriel is single, and wishes to continue growing his business so that he will be prepared to have a home and children.

loans.use: to invest in an assortment of groceries and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Don Feliciano de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, desde hace 20 años que se dedica a la crainza de pollos de engorde y es asi como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, comercailiza sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y tiene muchos clientes ya establecidos, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pollos y la construccion de una nueva galera para tener en un buen lugar a los pollos y asi seguir con la crianza.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 60 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their own house.

He has worked raising broiler chickens for the last 20 years, and in this way has been able to support his family. He sells his products in surrounding towns and already has many established customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and to build a new chicken pen, so that he will have a good space for the chickens and can continue raising them.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and to build a new chicken pen

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the materials she needs to create typical fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Severina

texts.es: La señora Severina vive en el área rural con su pareja, en calidad de casada, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda es rustica de adobe con techo de teja española que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su pareja para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura, en esta actividad lleva 24 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa su producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, habas, zanahoria y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Severina se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo económico para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza dos caminones), de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Severina lives in a rural area with her husband. She was able to study through a primary level. Her home is rustic, made of adobe with a Spanish roof, which does not have basic services.

She is a hard worker and with much optimism she and her husband work day to day to earn enough for their own sustenance. She works in agriculture. She has done this for 24 years, producing and selling her crops. What they harvest is taken to sell in provincial farmer's markets in the region and in neighboring towns. The main crops that they plant are potato in large quantities, beans, carrots and others in smaller quantities generally for their own consumption.

Severina saw the need to ask for the loan to purchase organic fertilizer (hen droppings), and in this way be able to increase production, continue selling and earn more to better their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to increase her production.  With her commercialization she will earn more to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Eduard Andres

texts.en:
Eduard is 24 years old and lives in the municipality of el Carmen de Viboral. He’s a young man but a hard worker with a lot of dreams. His family was having some economic issues so he decided to start his own business. He started a farm where he grows different products; work he learned thanks to his father.

Eduard is looking for some ways to improve his business. He wants to invest in it, in order to increase his growing, so that his business can last in time. The inputs can get really expensive, and he doesn’t have the amount of money for it, so he’s asking for a loan so he can buy some cuttings, saran (mesh used to protect the growing), fertilizers and irrigation.

Eduard has many dreams, and since he was a little boy, he knew that in the future he would give his family a house where they can live safely and comfortably. He wants to accomplish that. You can help Eduard to achieve all his goals and dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy some cuttings, saran, fertilizers and irrigation

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María, de 59 años de edad, está casada y tiene 10 hijos, 6 de ellos ya están acompañados y vive aparte y solo 4 viven con ella, quienes les ayudan en los cultivos  y depende económicamente de ella.

María, estudio hasta tercer grado, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, tiene 40 años de experiencia en la agricultura y 20 años de experiencia en la ganadería, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres y con el tiempo lo ha ido mejorando con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos menores.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono para 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y pagar los mozos.

María, sueña con que sus hijos continúen con la actividad agrícola y pecuaria que les han heredado de generación en generación.
texts.en:
María, 59 years old is married and has 10 children. Six of them are married and live apart, only four live with her. The four help with the crops and depend on Maria economically.

Maria studied through third grade. She works in agriculture and livestock. She has 40 years of experience in agriculture and 20 years of experience in the cattle industry. She learned from her parents and over time she has improved with the help of her husband and her younger children.

She needs the loan to purchase fertilizer for 21,000 square meters of corn and to pay the workers. Maria dreams that her children will continue with the agricultural work and the cattle which has been handed down from generation to generation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for 21,000 square meters of corn and pay the workers.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is taking a new loan at Kubo and Kiva after succeeding with the first one. He is now 50 years old. He has three children but he only provides for one. The other two are old enough to work by themselves. He is divorced and gives alimony to his former wife. He does his best to provide for his youngest son.

Pedro makes a living by driving a taxi. He is a hard working person who works six days a week, and almost twelve hours per day. He claims to be a responsible and dedicated person. He started to drive his taxi five years ago.

His biggest accomplishments have come after the hardest times he has faced. Not long after his divorce his first taxi was stolen, so he went unemployed, but he didn't gave up. He got a new car and started again.

With a previous loan from Kubo and Kiva, he managed to fix his taxi to save fuel. Today he is looking for a 5,000 MXN loan to complete the first payment for a new car. Therefore he will own two taxis. He will work with the new one and will hire a driver to drive the old one.

loans.use: to complete the first payment for a new taxi

loans.name: Jerson Alexis

texts.es: Jerson de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, su hermano y su hija, el es empleado de una empresa privada desde hace 3 años y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante con su familia, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales necesarios y pago de mano de obra para tener una vivienda segura.
texts.en:
Jerson is 33 years old and lives with his mother, his brother, and his daughter in a house they own. 

He has been working for a private company for 3 years, and with what he earns from his work manages to support himself and his family. 

He wants to improve their home by changing the doors, but because he doesn't have sufficient capital, he is applying for a loan to purchase the necessary materials and pay the workers, so they can have a safe home.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials and pay the workers.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es: Maria de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee un camion en donde se realizan viajes desde hace 20 años, tiene un empleado quien se dedica a realizar los viajes, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mary is 57 years old and lives with her husband in their own home.  

She owns a truck that has been used to make various voyages for 20 years. She has an employee who makes the voyages, and has many clients because of her responsibility. 

With the earnings from this work she manages to cover the expenses that come up in their home. 

She is requesting a loan to buy tires and ensure maintenance on her vehicle, which is her only source of work, and to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and ensure maintenance on her vehicle

loans.name: Dúo Genoveva De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Genoveva de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Genoveva quien se dedica al bordado de blusas típicas a mano desde hace 3 años, tiene dos hijos y su esposo la apoya en todo.   Es vendedora ambulante de su aldea y es muy conocida por las personas por los bordados preciosos que hace.  Tiene pedido de bordados pero los hilos no le alcanzan por eso necesita un préstamo para comprar los hilos que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Genoveva de San Pedro Duo.

Genoveva is the leader of this group. She has been making embroideries by hand on traditional blouses for three years. She has two children, and her husband gives her his full support. She works as a street vendor, and is well-known locally thanks to the beautiful embroideries she makes.

Her customers have asked her for embroideries, but she does not have enough threads to make them. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy the threads she needs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make embroideries to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias De San Martin Group

texts.es: Dúo las Victorias de San Martin La encargada de este grupo es la señora Maria de 54 años de edad, quien vive en una de las calles principales del pueblo.  Tiene una hija y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y lucha para que el negocio crezca cada día, Hay varios pedidos que tiene que cumplirle a sus compradoras y le hace falta mercaderia en calzado por eso necesita otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta y tener una bonita venta.
texts.en:
Duo las Victorias de San Martin.
 
The leader of this group is Maria, a 54-year-old lady who lives in one of the town's main streets.  

She has one daughter and can count on her husband's unconditional support. She strives to make her business grow every day. 

She has several orders from her buyers that she needs to satisfy, and she needs a better stock of footwear. 

For these reasons, she needs another loan to fill these needs and have good sales.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Santos Arminjol

texts.es:
Santos Arminjol con 46 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Santos Arminjol se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado vacuno. Con experiencia en el rubro hace 15 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de ganado, esto le ayudará a incrementar su número de reses y con esto engordarlo,así poseer mayores ganancias.

Socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa, a manejado créditos, los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
46-year-old Santos Arminjol lives with his spouse and children in the district of Cañaris, province of Ferreñafe, department of Lambayeque in Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the region's inhabitants. 

Santos Arminjol works raising and selling cattle. He has 15 years of experience in this field. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle, which will help him increase the number of animals he owns and have better profits. 

He is a regular partner of the Edpyme Alternative association. He has already had loans, which he repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Juan Andres

texts.en:
Juan is just 18 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. Since he was a little boy, he always dreamed of having his own business, and being a successful entrepreneur, so he could help his family that has given so much to him. Now that he’s an adult, he wants to start his agricultural business.

Juan's mother encouraged him to go for it, and taught him some things he needed to know so he can do a good job. His family doesn’t have the money that starting a business needs, so in order to have a big crop, he’s asking for a loan to buy bean seeds, fertilizers and bags for collection.

Juan dreams of helping his family so he can thank them for everything. He also would like to give a present to his mother by improving the house where they live. You can be part of the beginning of a great story for this young man, and make a loan to help him accomplish great things.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fertilizers and bags for collection.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis is just 24 years old and lives in the municipality of Don Matias. He lives with his girlfriend and mother of his little son (in photo) who is only two years of age and has become his motor and main reason to live. Last year, he decided to start his own business in order to give to his family a better life; he raises cattle.

This man wants to invest in the business so he can increase his clients and with those, his profits. To achieve that, he needs some money but the high costs of the inputs are a problem for him. So he asked for a loan to buy some steers to raise and food for them.

Luis dreams of paying for his son's education and buying a house where his family can live safely and comfortably. You can help Luis to accomplish all his dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy some steers to raise and food for them.

loans.name: Rigobertoo

texts.es:
Rigoberto, de 50 años de edad, está casado, es padre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos aún viven con él y continúan estudiando bachillerato, él estudio hasta sexto grado. 

Rigoberto, es albañil y agricultor, tiene 25 años de dedicarse a estas actividades, desde que estaba muy joven sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la tierra y a ser responsable, siempre se ha dedicado al trabajo agrícola, el hace sus siembras en las cercanías del cantón y se desplaza a una distancia de 1 kilómetro aproximadamente desde su casa hasta sus cultivos y las actividades las realiza regularmente por la mañana y le ayuda uno de sus hijos.

Rigoberto, necesita el préstamo para comprar un molino, con esta adquisición espera obtener una fuente de ingresos para él y su familia y brindarles una mejor condición económica. 

Rigoberto, sueña con construir su casa de ladrillo, porque donde actualmente vive es de lámina, con la ayuda de el crédito espera poder mejorar mucho más su condición económica y brindar más comodidad y seguridad para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, aged 50, is married and has three children, two of whom live with him and are studying for their high school diplomas. Rigoberto left school after the sixth grade.

Rigoberto is a bricklayer and farmer, and has 25 years' experience in these fields. His parents taught him to farm and to be responsible from a young age. He has always worked in agriculture, and plants his crops on the outskirts of the community, approximately 1 kilometer from his home. He works in his fields every morning, and is helped by one of his sons.

Rigoberto is requesting a loan to buy a grain mill. With this purchase, he hopes to gain an income for his family and be able to provide them with better economic conditions.

Rigoberto dreams of building a brick house, because his current home is made of tin sheeting. With the help of this loan, he hopes to improve his economic situation considerably, and to be able to provide his family with more comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy a grain mill.

loans.name: Nestor Adan

texts.en:
Nestor is 27 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. Last year, he started his own business, so he can provide for his family. He raises pigs to sell later.

He wants to make his business sustainable, so he can keep providing for his family. He lacks money to invest in his business, so he’s asking for a loan, so he can buy pigs, as well as feed and vaccines for them.

Nestor dreams of improving the conditions of his house and you can be part of his story. Help him with a loan and let him be closer to accomplishing all his dreams.

loans.use: to buy pigs, as well as feed and vaccines for them.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 51 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijas, una estudia noveno grado y la otra trabaja con ella en el negocio y en su casa también vive un nieto.	

María, tiene una tortillería desde hace 4 años, ella decidió colocar ese negocio porque no habían más puestos de ese tipo, cerca de donde ella vive; pero además de eso se dedica a la venta de empanadas y su hija es la que le ayuda y trabaja todos los día de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.															

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar leña y almacenarla, comprar maíz y guardarlo, para no comprarlo más caro después.

Lo que María, sueña es que su hija siga estudiando y llegue a ser profesional y también lograr comprar un puesto en el mercado y vender ahí sus tortillas.
texts.en:
51-year-old Maria never went to school. She is a single mother and lives with her two daughters -- one is in the 9th grade and the other one helps Maria with her business. Maria's grandson also lives with them.

Maria has had a tortilla shop for four years. She decided to start this business as there were no similar businesses near where she lives. She also sells empanadas. Her daughter helps her and they work every day from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. 

Maria needs a loan to buy firewood and corn, which she will store in order not to have to buy them at a more expensive price later on. 														

Maria dreams for her daughter to continue studying so that she becomes a professional. She also would like to buy a stand in the local market and to sell her products there.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Soysing

texts.en:
Soysing is a 20-year-old, single staff member; she is working for a company in the city. She is from the Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has worked in the company since 2014, making an income of USD 7 per day.

Currently, Soysing is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the city. Her mother is a widowed grocer at the market. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her university fees from the third to fourth year, she would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully.

For her dreams, Soysing is going to find a better job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to save money to renovate her mother’s house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from the third to fourth year.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Ice candy is a unique Filipino delicacy. It is a frozen treat just like an ice cream, but it is more affordable and easier to prepare. Its basic ingredients are water, milk and sugar. The mixture is combined with any flavor like chocolate for chocolate ice candy, buko (or young coconut) for buko ice candy, banana, mango, melon, jackfruit, and many other flavors. Then it is set to freeze in a narrow plastic wrapper called ice candy wrapper. The end product is quite refreshing during the dry season with hot weather. 

Marilyn, 46 years old, from Santa Barbara, Iloilo, chose to venture into ice candy making 10 years ago. She took advantage of the good supply of fruits in their place and made it into delicious ice candy. She was able to improve her business, and now she is supplying many stores and street vendors. Ice candy vendors are commonly seen with portable coolers, roving in different communities, either urban or rural. 

Marilyn would like to buy another freezer and high volume of ingredients for ice candy making. She appeals for a PHP 25,000 loan for this purpose. Additional income that will be derived from this investment will continuously provide for her family’s daily needs and college expenses of her children.

Marilyn is married to Rafael, who has a "buy and sell" business. They want to bestow a successful business on their children someday. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy another freezer and high volume of ingredients for ice candy making

loans.name: Pedro Manuel

texts.en:
Pedro is 66 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. He has three big sons whom he loves very much and feels proud of the kind of people they’ve become. Two years ago, Pedro was able to accomplish one of his biggest dreams, to have his own business, and thanks to his father he raises pigs.

He inherited this business from his family and feels a big responsibility for them. This is the reason why he is always thinking about the best ways to improve the business so it can be sustainable. He is asking for a loan so he can buy some pigs, food for them, vaccines, and vitamins.

Pedro wants to see his business as a successful one, and he’s working hard to accomplish that, so his family enjoys the fruits of his work. Help Pedro with his business by loaning, and watch him do great things with it.

loans.use: to buy some pigs, food for them, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora, de 59 años de edad, no pudo estudiar debido a los escasos recursos económicos que tenían sus padres, está soltera, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo 4 viven con ella en su vivienda, pero también viven con ella 3 de sus nietos.

Teodora, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y sus 3 nietos trabajan para ayudarle en los gastos del hogar, 2 de ellos trabajan como sastres, confeccionando ropa, el otro se dedica a la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijol para suplir las necesidades del hogar.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes y agro-quimicos que son necesarios para que los cultivos sean más productivos.

Su sueño para el futuro es obtener una buena producción de granos básicos y brindarle a su familia lo necesario para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teodora is 59 years old, and could not get an education because her parents had limited resources. She is single, has seven children; only four of them live at home with her, but three of her grandchildren also live with her.

Teodora is a housekeeper, and her three grandchildren work to help her with the household expenses. Two of them work as tailors, making clothing, and the other one is engaged in farming, planting corn and beans to meet the household needs.

The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of fertilizer, and agro-chemicals needed for more productive crops.

Her dream for the future is to obtain a good production of basic grains, and provide her family with what they need for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and agro-chemicals needed for more productive crops.

loans.name: Transito Carolina

texts.es:
Tránsito, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, cuando tenía 15 años de edad se acompañó, su pareja se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil desde hace tres años, antes solo era agricultor, tiene 3 hijos y todos están estudiando.

Tránsito, por las mañanas trabajar como empleada doméstica de una vecina, pero también hace atol y tamales de elote para vender, ella vive a la orilla de la carretera y tiene bastantes clientes y por la tarde lava y hace la comida de los niños y de su pareja.- 

El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar plátanos para iniciar a vender tostadas, ya que ella las puede hacer y tiene otras personas que las venderán.

El sueño más grande de Tránsito, es formar una fábrica de hacer tostadas.
texts.en:
Tránsito is 28 years old and studied up until sixth grade. When she was 15 years old, she entered into a long-term relationship. Her partner has worked as a construction worker for three years, and before that he was a farmer. She has three children and all of them are in school.

In the morning, Tránsito works as a housekeeper for a neighbor, but she also makes atol [a cornflour-based drink], and corn tamales that she sells. She lives on the side of the highway and has many customers. In the afternoon, she does the wash and makes food for her children and her partner.

The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of plantains in order to start selling fried plantain snacks, since she knows how to make them and has other people who will sell them. Her biggest dream is to build a factory of fried plantain snacks.

loans.use: to purchase plantains to start selling fried plantain snacks.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.en:
Ada is 46 years old and lives in the municipality of Tierralata. She’s a strong and determined woman who works hard to accomplish her dreams. She provides for her family thanks to a business raising chickens and pigs. She began 10 years ago because she loves to work with animals.

For a long time she’s been thinking about improving her business so she can increase her profits and also ensure that her business continues to keep providing for her family. She’s asking for a loan so she can improve the barn and also buy food for the chickens and pigs.

Ada has many dreams, but right now she expects that her investment will improve her business a lot. She also would like to make some repairs to her house. You can help Aida accomplish her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to improve the barn and buy food for the chickens and the pigs.

loans.name: Sokleap's Group

texts.en: Sokleap’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokleap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Felix Jose

texts.en:
Felix is 60 years and lives in the municipality of Momil. He has a son who is 12 years old and the main reason Felix wishes to succeed in life.

A few years ago, Felix opened a store that has brought many good things to this family.

Now, Felix wants to take his business further by investing in it. He expects that he can increase his stored inventory so his customers will find everything in his store. He also wants to create a new business. He is asking for a loan to buy food and personal use products for his store and some pigs and feed for his new business.

Felix is always thinking big. That’s why he wants to improve his store and to create a new business, all to give his family a good life. Help Felix reach all his dreams with a loan will get him so much closer to accomplish them all.

loans.use: to buy food and personal use products and for a new business buying some pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Carmen Cruz

texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. She has two daughters and one son who are the inspirations in Carmen’s life. Recently, the family has been going through a rough time because the economy is bad, so Carmen decided to start her own business raising pigs.

She was able to take some classes so she learned all about her new job. She expects that her business can be very successful and generate good profit. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some pigs and food to fatten them up.

Carmen expects that her business can last a long time and provide for her family, giving them a good quality of life. You can be part of this mother’s story by helping make her business successful and her family happy. A loan will allow her to accomplish big things.

loans.use: to buy some pigs and food to fatten them up.

loans.name: Yerlis Janeth

texts.en:
Yerlis is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. Since she was a little girl she has always dreamed about having her own business so she would be able to provide for her family. Searching for a way to thank them for everything, now it’s the moment, so she’s going to start a business raising pigs.

A close friend taught her everything she needs to know about raising pigs, so she’s ready to start. She expects that her business can be sustainable and give her a good amount of profits. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some pigs and food to fatten them up.

Yerlis wants to give a present to her family. In addition to providing for them, she expects to improve the conditions of the house where they are living right now. You can be part of Yerlis’s story and help her with the loan she needs.

loans.use: buy some pigs and food to fat them up

loans.name: Cesia Vanessa

texts.es:
Cesia, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer joven, está soltera y vive con su madre y un hermano.

Cesia, posee un cafetin en la cancha de basketball de la ciudad, fueron sus amigos quienes la motivaron para que colocara este negocio en ese lugar; ella aparte de eso también trabaja como maestra de las cachiporras, ella viaja a 5 kilómetros diarios hacia su cafetin y su horario de venta es de 9:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m.

Cesia, necesita el préstamo para pagar los impuestos en la alcaldía y para comprar más mercadería para su negocio, porque tiene mucha demanda de clientes y quiere tener más diversidad de productos.

Cesia, sueña con ser Licenciada en Ciencias Jurídicas y ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Cesia, 25, is a young single woman, and lives with her mother and brother. She has a small café at the city’s basketball court, and her friends encouraged her to set up her business in this location. Besides this, she also works as a baton twirling instructor. She travels five kilometers per day to her café, and her sales hours are for 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

Cesia needs a loan to pay her taxes to the city, and to purchase more merchandise for her business because she has high customer demand, and wishes to offer a wider variety of products. Cesia dreams of getting her law degree, and becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay her taxes to the city, and to purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Buntherun's Group

texts.en: Buntherun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Buntherun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en: Channy’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Channy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Vivian es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de tortas.
Ella es buena madre, feliz y muy alegre. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ zona que sirve de conducto para llegar a otras poblaciones. 
Vivian es morena de físico robusto y cabello negro largo (la tercera de la derecha, viste cartera rosa). Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como transportista y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta sólo con energía eléctrica porque en el lugar no existe el agua potable. Su deseo de superación la impulso a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de jugos, comercio de huevo, venta de verduras, venta de ropa de segunda mano, taller de electricidad, artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros de sao y venta de cosméticos. Su negocio es la venta de tortas; ella cuenta con un pequeño horno donde realiza tortas y queques también vende otras especialidades tradicionales como; cuñapes y pan de arroz, “vendo tortas y todo tipo de masas, los queques son muy vendidos a la hora del té…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de diferentes tipos de harina como de; yuca, maíz, trigo y otras. Su sueño es tener una tienda donde vender sus pasteles, ella desea comprar harina de diferentes tipos por quintal para hornear tortas y pasteles. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Vivian solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por quintal para hornear tortas y pasteles.
texts.en:
Vivian, aged 32, lives with her husband and two children, aged 6 and 14, and has a business selling cakes.

She is a good mother, always happy and vivacious. She carries out her business in the 'Cotoca' area, which is on the route to other villages.

Vivian has a dark complexion, a robust physique, and long black hair (she is the third from the right in the photo, wearing a pink shirt). Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish. Her husband is a transportation worker, and her children attend school. She lives in her own home, which is built of wood and has electricity but no water, as drinking water is not available in the area.

Her determination to succeed led her to lead a group of people from a variety of different jobs, such as: selling toys, eggs, vegetables, and second-hand clothing, an electrician, an artisan leather-worker, a straw hat maker, and a cosmetic retailer.

Her business is selling pastries and cakes: she has a small oven where she prepares pastries and cakes, as well as traditional specialties such as cuñapes (cheese bread balls) and pan de arroz (a local dessert). “I sell cakes and all kinds of pastries, and the cakes are very popular at tea-time" she says. On the plus side, her business has a loyal clientele, but, on the down side, she lacks the finance to be able to buy a range of flours such as yuca, corn, wheat and others.

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her cakes, and would like to be able to buy different types of flour by the quintal [46 kilos/104 pounds]. This is their first loan cycle with the institution in the two years that it has been offering the service.

For these reasons, Vivian is requesting a loan to buy flour to bake cakes and pastries.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk to bake cakes and pastries.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Of her ten years in the food vending business in Pasay City, Jennifer has already encountered a lot of ups and downs in the business world that made her a better person today. But also throughout these years, her membership in CCT has impacted more in her life. Through CCT, she was able to know Kiva that helped her avail loans to develop her businesses. 

Today, she continues to supervise a food processing business. Here, she is able to earn enough for her family. As of now, this business contributes a lot in satisfying almost everything her family needs. 

However, Jennifer doesn’t want to settle with what’s just present. She is planning to further develop her resources. With this, she needs you. Your help will definitely actualize her plan by allowing her to have a loan that would maximize and increase her food products and other materials needed for business expansion. She needs 10,000 PHP for this. 

In advance, she would like to thank you for your generosity. 

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and products needed in her food vending business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia, age 57, is from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Ferdinand with whom she has five children, two of them married, two in college and one working. They live a simple life, happy that they are intact and loving each other.

Julia runs a small general store. To help her expand her business, she is seeking a PHP 15,000 loan to fill her small store with essential food items such as bread, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries. Although there are times she has difficulty collecting her receivables from some of her customers, she still maintains a positive and understanding attitude towards them.

She dreams of having a big grocery store. She prays for God to bless her abundantly in all areas of her life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for canned goods, instant noodles, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra Irene

texts.es: Alejandra es una microempresaria que por tradición familiar se dedica a la elaboración de bollos, masa para arepas, buñuelos y natilla; actividad en la que lleva seis años de trayectoria aportando bienestar a su pequeña hija de tres años de edad. Ella es madre soltera responsable de la crianza de su hija y al no contar con la compañía y el apoyo de su pareja, su hija ha estado ceñida a un estilo de familia monoparental, lo que le exige a  Alejandra ser muy entregada a su labor es por ello que diariamente inicia su producción a las 4 a.m. y en cuanto quedan terminado sus productos los distribuye a tiendas del municipio de Cartagena.  En la actualidad  está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar maíz y harina a campesinos en Maria La Baja, inversión que le permitirá aumentar su producción y tener mayores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta a futuro es tener más clientela y ofrecer una excelente educación académica a su hija.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a microentrepreneur who, in keeping with family tradition, makes "bollos" [traditional Colombian corn-based cake], corn-based flour, "buñuelos" [traditional Colombian fried dough ball], and "natilla" [traditional Colombian custard-like dessert]. She has been doing this for six years, thus supporting the wellbeing of her three-year-old daughter.

She is a single mother who is responsible for raising her daughter, and since she does not have the company nor the support of her partner, her daughter has had to adjust to this type of single-parent family. This means that Alejandra must be very dedicated to her work, and thus she starts production every day at 4am. When the products are finished, she distributes them to stores within the municipality of Cartagena.

Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to purchase corn and flour from farmers in María La Baja. This investment will allow her to increase her production and have higher income in order to sustain her family. Her goal for the future is to have more customers and offer an excellent academic education to her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase corn and flour from farmers in María La Baja.

loans.name: Neder Augusto

texts.en:
Neder is 40 years old and lives in the municipality of Tierralta. He has a daughter who is 8 years old and whom he loves very much. She’s the reason for his hard work and his desire to succeed. Some months ago, he decided to start his own business raising pigs. He learned pig farming from his father.

Neder works around 12 hours per day all week, so his animals are well cared for. He is increasing his profits and making his business sustainable. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy pigs to raise and food for them.

Neder’s love for his family is infinite, and he dreams of giving them the best quality of life he can,. He wishes to support an excellent education for his daughter. You can be part of this dream by helping him with the loan he needs.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and food for them.

loans.name: Augusto Rafael

texts.en:
Augusto is 50 years old and lives in the municipality of Barbacoas. He has 3 children, 2 girls and 1 boy, whom he not only loves but admires a lot because they are great children. Five years ago, in order to give to his family a better quality of life, he started his own business; he raises pigs to sell them later. 

His father was his mentor in all the process, so he’s really thankful to him. Now, he wants to be more competitive in the market and make his business last in time, and for that, he’s aware that he needs to invest in his business, for which reason he's asking for a loan in order to buy pigs, food for them and some vaccines they need.

Augusto is working hard not only to provide for his family, but because he expects to make his business successful so one day he can leave it to his children. You can make all of this happen by supporting him with the loan he needs.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food for them and some vaccines they need

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tienen 4 hijos.

Pedro, es un agricultor, este trabajo lo ha desempeñado desde que estaba muy pequeño, se encuentra trabajando en una empresa a 39 kilómetros de su vivienda. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar cerdos y para darle mantenimiento a su corral.

Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando para tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: Pedro, 39, has a sixth grade education, and he is in a common-law relationship.  He partner is engaged in doing the household chores, and they have four children.  Pedro is a farmer, and has been doing this work since he was very young. He is working at a company 39 kilometers from his home.  He needs the loan to purchase pigs, and maintain his coral.  His dream is to be able to keep working so that he and his family may have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, and maintain his coral.

loans.name: Bunchorn's Group

texts.en: Bunchorn’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Bunchorn works as a farmer and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Mariposa Group

texts.es:
Maria continúa con su negocio de confección de sábanas. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de rollos de tela, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su producción. Actualmente continúa liderando la banca de emprendimiento (la tercera de la izquierda, viste polera a rayas horizontales amarilla y pantalón capri rosa), su negocio mejoró y poco a poco se estabiliza, “con el crédito anterior pude producir mayor cantidad, eso me ayudo con los gastos de mi hijo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de tela por rollo. Su sueño es abrir una tienda, ella desea comprar tela por rollo para confeccionar sábanas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para confeccionar sábanas y abrir un puesto de venta de ropa de cama.
texts.en:
Maria still works making sheets. She invested her previous loan in purchasing rolls of fabric. She was able to sell all of her products, so she made all of her repayments on time. She is currently still leading her communal bank. (She is the third person from the left in the photo, wearing a yellow striped top).

Her business has improved and is gradually becoming more stable. "My previous loan allowed me to produce more quantity, and that helped me with my son's expenses..." she says. Her business has the advantage of consistent sales. Her main disadvantage is a lack of enough capital to buy fabric by the roll. Her dream is to open a shop. She has been in this business for three years and this is her second loan cycle with this organization. She wants to buy more fabric by the roll in order to make more sheets.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy wholesale fabric for making sheets and to open a bedding store.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric for making sheets.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida was able to improve her meat-dealing business because of the previous loan granted to her. She was able to increase her profit and likewise repay the loan faithfully. 

She has been in this trade for almost 10 years now; and for this long span of time, the business has provided her family a source of living. This is very reliable since everything now in the society disappoints its citizens, from the cost of food products and basic necessities to the increasing number of unemployment.

At least when you have your own business, you’ll be somehow relieved not to worry where to get a source of living within the depriving community. 

Zenaida wants to continue the operation of her business in the next few years. With this, she would like to ask help from you. She asks for a loan worth  35,000 PHP, which she will use or incorporate in buying more meat products needed in her distribution business. 

This is a big help for her, and she entrusts you with the future of her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more meat products needed in her business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable business and earn more money. After purchasing goods with her previous loan from GDMPC, Esterlita increased her sales and she had plan to expand her offerings. She repaid her previous loan successfully because she was earning a better income.

Esterlita took a new loan recently to purchase good items to add to her inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to renovate her house for a safer and more comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase good items to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan is 52 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. He is a single man who has fought hard in life so he can give his family a good life. It hasn’t been easy for him, but he’s a man who always thinks positive and works hard. He feels now is the opportunity to start his own business raising pigs, so he’s going to do it.

He expects with his new business to solve some economic issues his family is having. He also wishes his business can give him good profits and can last for a long time. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy pigs to fatten them up and the food to do it.

Juan dreams of having a successful business and he’s aware that he has to work hard to accomplish that, but with a little help it could be easier for him to fulfill his goals, so loan now and help him get closer to them.

loans.use: buy pigs to fatten them up and the food to do it.

loans.name: Javid Elias

texts.en:
Javid is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. He’s a single man who recently decided to start his own business; his father helped him like a guide and a teacher, so he learned everything about it. Now he is the happy owner of a pig-raising business.

It hasn’t been easy because of the amount of similar businesses in his location, but he knows that with good sales strategies and hard work, he can improve his business and make it successful. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy pigs, food for them, some vaccines, and vitamins.

Javid wants to thank his father and wants to give him a present: to improve the conditions of the house where they all live. Help Javid to accomplish this dream and more with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food for them, some vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.en:
Rosalba is 43 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. She has three children - two boys and one girl - who she loves very much and who are the reasons for Rosalba’s life. For a while she has been thinking of starting her own business in order to improve her family’s quality of life and now she is determined to do so.

Rosalba is going to start a store in her town with the help of her brother who has taught her a lot about managing that kind of business. Her principal goals are to earn good profits and for her business last. Rosalba is asking for a loan so she can buy food and personal use products to sell.

Rosalba is aware of how much hard work she has to put into her business in order to make it successful. She dreams of paying for an excellent education for her children. Help her accomplish all that and more with just a loan.

loans.use: buy food and personal use products to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 59 años de edad, no pudo estudiar por motivo de escasos recursos económicos, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ellos.

Alejandro, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo al trabajo de la agricultura, dicho trabajo fue aprendido gracias a su padre; anteriormente, se dedicaba a la crianza de bovinos para luego venderlos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y productos agro-quimicos para aplicarlos a sus cultivos, para obtener buenos resultados.

Su sueño es trabajar fuertemente con la ganadería y apoyar a su hijo en la educación.
texts.en: Alejandro, 59, could not study because of his family's limited resources.  He is married, and his wife is engaged in housekeeping.  They have four children, and two live with them.  Alejandro has been engaged in farming for a long time, and learned this trade form his father.  Previously, he was engaged in raising cattle for later sale.  He needs the loan to purchase fertilizer, and agro-chemical products for application to his crops in order to obtain better results.  His dream is to work hard with the cattle, and support his son’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and agro-chemical products for application to his crops.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: This loan of $600 will allow Veronica to send her brother to the university. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies. Veronica loves her brother very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, school registration and school clothes.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
A warm appreciation and gratefulness flows in Federico's heart because of the assistance previously granted to him. The loan has been utilized in purchasing more merchandise toy items for his store which resulted in additional income for him.

But there is still a longing for Federico to further grow his business. This is why he is asking to take out a loan worth PHP 15,000 that he will use to buy more stock of various kinds of toys.

With hope and faith, he believes that one day he will see his children as successful professionals. For now, he is working very hard to make that dream come true. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities and varieties of toy products to sell.

loans.name: Etelberto De Jesus

texts.en:
Etelberto is 50 years old and lives in the municipality of Taraza. He has two children, a boy who is 6 and a girl who is 10 years of age. For Etelberto, his family is the most important thing, so he has decided to give them a good life. That is why he is going to start his own business raising fish.

Etelberto's family has some economic issues that he wants to solve. A friend taught him everything he needs to know about fish raising, so he believes he can start a productive business that earns him good profits and that will last. He is asking for a loan to buy 400 meters of hose, a shadow mesh, 4,000 juvenile fish, and 30 packs of fish food.

Etelberto trusts that his business is going to be a successful one and that one day he will be able to leave it to his children, starting a family tradition that gives all of them a good quality of life. Loan now and help this man to start with the right foot.

loans.use: to buy 400 meters of hose, a shadow mesh, 4,000 juvenile fish, and 30 packs of fish food.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda owns and operates a food-selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for six years and is earning well to sustain their living. With her revenue, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid.

Improving the business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase meat such as pork, beef and chicken, and assorted drinks. She plans to accept catering services in order to gain more revenue.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for more menus.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has proven that there can always be ways to succeed if only someone wills it. She was just new in her Piso Net business, but despite that, she lifts her best effort to flourish and prosper in this.

In fact, in order to do so, she borrowed a certain amount from Kiva previously, and that allowed her to further strengthen this.

But of course, income would not always be stable at all times. There are always unprecedented circumstances that hinder her in continuing her business operations, particularly when she has insufficient capital.

Hence, she would like to again request a loan of PHP 20,000 for additional capital that she would use for the maintenance of her computer units. She truly hopes that you can assist her with this. This is her only way she can build an established future for her family.

Emma regularly meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans, and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to pay the maintenance cost for units used in her Piso Net business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita believes in the importance of hard work. She could probably spend 16 hours of working a day just to escape the typical 8 hours long. Because she believes that success comes to those entrepreneurs who think about other people's convenience rather than their own, she has taken every opportunity to develop her business.

In fact, recently, Emelita borrowed a loan from Kiva that she used for her business. Having faithfully paid back her previous loan, she would respectfully like to take another loan worth PHP 50,000, which she will use to purchase more grocery items like shampoo, biscuits, condiments, and other products.

Emelita sincerely wants to let you know her appreciation for your deep generosity and kindness. She won't betray your trust if you let her take this loan. With assurance, she promises to grab this open door to further enlarge her enterprise and make headway on her dream of having her own house and lot someday.

Emelita faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like shampoo, biscuits, condiments, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Ana Manuela

texts.es: Ana es una microempresaria que desde la comodidad de su hogar ofrece servicios de llamadas y recargas a todos los operadores a celular.  Ella es madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad y su negocio es el único sustento que tiene para ofrecer a sus hijos bienestar, es por ello que su compromiso y dedicación es tan grande y diariamente a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., está dispuesta a atender a sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de celulares y realizará adecuaciones a su vivienda para tener unas mejores condiciones de habitabilidad. Con esta inversión su negocio ampliará su capacidad y con ello sus ingresos incrementarán. Su meta a futuro es poner un local comercial y ofrecer la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana runs a micro business which offers calls and recharge services for all mobile phone operators from the comfort of her customers' own homes. She is a single mother with three young children, and her business is the only source of income for her family. For this reason, she works tirelessly and with dedication, and is available daily from 8am to 6pm to attend to her customers.

She is currently applying for her first CrediKiva loan through the intermediary of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy cell phones and to make repairs to her home in order to improve the living conditions. With this investment, she will be able to expand her business and increase her earnings. Her dream for the future is to be able to have a store and to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, and to make improvements to her home in order to improve the living conditions.

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.en:
Olga is 36 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. She has six children between the ages of 18 and 9; they are 3 girls and 3 boys. She loves her big family and feels very proud of it, but having such a big family implies many responsibilities and money, the reason why she’s going to start her own business. She is going to raise chickens.

She expects big things from her business, because she is a determined woman who is going to work hard to accomplish her goals, so her business has good profits and can last in time. She’s asking for a loan so she can built a barn and buy chickens and food for them.

Olga dreams of improving her house conditions because they are not the best, and she expects to accomplish that thanks to her successful business, which can be with your help. Loan now and watch this mother fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to build a barn and buy chickens and food for them.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Aracely de 52 años de edad  vive con su esposo hijo y dos nietos de 12 y 8 años el hijo trabaja fuera y ella queda a cargo de los dos nietos, ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora y quiere ayudar a sus nietos dándole una mejor calidad de vida. Ella tiene un convenio con la escuela de su localidad el cual le da permiso para vender en el chalet de este centro escolar esta es la fuente generadora de ingresos para su familia es por esto que ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: golosinas, frutas, refrescos, galletas, etc. Para mejorar las ganancias del negocio, ella espera le aprueben su crédito para invertir en su negocio pues ve la necesidad de surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Aracely, aged 52, lives with her husband, her son and two grandchildren aged 12 and 8. Her son works abroad, and she looks after the grandchildren. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman, who wants to help her grandchildren and give them a better quality of life.

She has an agreement with the local school which allows her to sell snacks from the school premises. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy candy, fruit, soda and cookies, etc., in order to expand her stock and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to stock her store with  candy, fruit, sodas, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in block, sand, cement, iron, and labor, in order to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista owns and operates a food-selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for five years and earns well to sustain their living. With her revenue, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid.

Improving the business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase meat such as pork, beef and chicken, and assorted drinks. She plans to accept catering services in order to gain more revenue.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for more menus to sell.

loans.name: John Ivony

texts.en:
John Ivory is single and is 19 years of age. In order to help his family in supporting and providing their daily needs, he engaged in transportation services. He has owned and managed his motorcycle transportation business for one year and he has actively driven and sent passengers to designated areas safely. It allows him to earn PHP 10,000 a month. He joined and gained access to GDMPC and recently, he borrowed a loan in an amount of PHP 20,000 to buy tires and finance the costs to renew licenses and registration.

The availability of this fund is a channel to facilitate operations immediately. With this loan, John is expecting to pursue his job with a motor vehicle in good running condition to provide satisfactory service to customers. He hopes to sustain the family's daily needs and improve further service capacity.

loans.use: to buy tires and finance the costs to renew licenses and registration for his motorcycle transportation businesss.

loans.name: Sreyyo

texts.en:
Sreyyo is a 22-year-old single student who resides in the Battambang Province of Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in nursing , and is in her second year at a university in the province. Her family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for her tuition fees.

Because Sreyyo is short of finances to cover her tuition fees from the third to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and earn skills to achieve her future goal. In the future, she hopes to run her own clinic, and she also wants to build a new house for her family; and if she has children she wants her children to study and pursue their bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to cover her tuition fees from the third to the fourth year

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: Musole est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Ujamaa», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 31 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en tomates, aubergines, etc. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Musole works in small retail business.  She is a member of the credit group Ujamaa and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima.  She is 31 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children, three of whom go to school while the youngest is still a baby.  She has been selling food products at a market in town for the past three years.  She will use her loan to buy tomatoes, eggplants etc.  She started her own business with some money received as a loan.  She wants to purchase a plot of land and continue to feed her children and send them to school.  She thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and eggplants.

loans.name: Zuleima Del Carmen

texts.en:
Zuleima Del Carmen is 35 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She has four children, two sons and two daughters, whom she loves and feels proud of. Five years ago, this woman accomplished one of her biggest dreams, to create her own business. Now, she’s the owner of a store that provides for many people in her location.

Her brother was the one who helped her begin this dream and now she works hard to keep improving it and make it grow. The most important thing for her is that it will allow her to provide for her family for many years.

Zuleima Del Carmen’s asking for a loan, so she can buy inputs for her store, like food and other items. She also wants to start a new business, so will buy pigs and feed for them.

Zuleima Del Carmen dreams that her children will grow up to be good people, so she wants to give them the best education she can. You can help her accomplish all of that and more with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy inputs for her store, like food and other items, and to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Martin Ezequiel

texts.es:
Martín, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado debido a que sus padres fallecieron después de tener un accidente.- Actualmente, está soltero, vive con su tía que lo cuido desde muy pequeño y con sus 2 primas.

Martín, desde que era un niño le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo, específicamente le enseñaron a sembrar granos básicos; pero ahora también se dedica a la compra y crianza de cerdos, para venderlos y obtener ingresos para mantener el negocio.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos para el cultivo de frijol y maíz y así obtener una buena producción de granos.

El sueña con seguir trabajando con la crianza y engorde de cerdos, para poder comercializar a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Martín is 25 years old and has a second grade education because his parents passed away in an accident. He is currently single and lives with his aunt, who has been taking care of him ever since he was little, and her two daughters.

Martín was taught to work in the fields as a child. Specifically, he learned how to grow basic grains. But now he also works buying and selling pigs. The income he makes allows him to keep his business going.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies to grow beans and corn so that he can get a good grain harvest. His other goal is to continue working raising and fattening pigs in order to get better prices for them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies to grow beans and corn.

loans.name: Leela

texts.en: Leela, 39 years old, is married and has two children. Many years ago, Leela established her construction business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. Leela has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy timber wood. In the future, she plans to uplift her family's economic conditions. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small construction store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Timber woods are purchased daily for construction of buildings, roads and other construction work. Owners of small stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a mother of 4 children, she's married and currently living in Panaon, Misamis occidental. She owns and manages her own repair shop, with the help of her husband who repairs vehicles; they consider it as their main source of income. She wants to expand and earn more profit. Recently, she joined and gained access to GDMPC. She borrowed a loan to buy tools and equipment to be used in the repair shop to offer better service to her customers.

Teresa's plan for the future is to save more money and plan for her children to go to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her vehicle repair shop.
